Reviews.Title: “Incredible location and excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Ilzedewet
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 409 with our own private balcony. Wow! Yes, the room, bathroom and shower are all small! You are in Europe - get over it!! We loved the breakfast spread - it was fresh and lovely. The best part of our stay, though was to wake up with the smell of freshly baked bread of the bakery right across the street and almost underneath our balcony. Over-all, the staff is friendly and accommodating, but some of them might want to reconsider another job which will suit them more. The location really is perfect and worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Rome”
Reviews.Author: mllespear
Reviews.Content: The location, cleanliness, and price combination of this hotel outweigh the problems. I was very impressed with how clean the rooms felt. That said, the rooms felt more like staying in a hostel. Little decor, no frills. My boyfriend and I ended up in a triple so the room was quite spacious for two people. (Three would have been cramped in my opinion, especially if you had suitcases.) There was not much hot water which added to the hostel feel. It never got icy, but lukewarm was the best it got. Our toilet would also not flush on random occasions. We also could hear everything going on in the hall and assumed that everyone could hear most of what we said in our room and walking down the hallway. Breakfast is included in the price which makes the price even more reasonable. The breakfast has good variety (meat, cheese, yogurt, breads, pastries, cake, cereal, coffee, tea, juice, water, milk but the pastries appeared to be and tasted like yesterday's leftovers and kinda stale). My boyfriend and I met a group of friends in Rome and we all stayed here. It was good for that because there is a lobby where we could all meet and plenty of seating so we could wait for each other. There is a computer there too so we could check on restaurants or email while we waited. The rooms also have internet. You need to ask at the desk for the code. There were no breakfast tables for 6 so we couldn't all sit together which was a little disappointing. The location was great! We all were very happy to be able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. The location seriously could not be any better. Also, if you take a taxi from the train station you should know that it should be around 10 euros. We paid more on our way there, not having any idea what Roman taxis charge. Bargain it down!

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best to be said.”
Reviews.Author: Aslaug2012
Reviews.Content: Super location, clean. Very easy to hear conversations in neighboring rooms, lukewarm water in the morning, rather indifferent staff. Will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robert d
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good value for money. Location is superb, all major sites are within walking distance. Rooms are probably rather small compared to non-European hotels, but this is quite usual in major cities, especially in the city centre. Breakfast is OK and will you keep going for the larger part of the day.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome... take what comes”
Reviews.Author: canerandagio
Reviews.Content: Rome is not an easy place for accommodation. Prices are high, distances are significant and reliability can leave you wanting, as you may book a place and find yourself elsewhere due to overbookings. I have done my research... and found that notwithstanding the small rooms, the uncertainty about getting a room in the hotel proper or in a nearby dependency, the not cheap prices, and the typical romanesque rudeness, this hotel was not bad at all. It's situated very near campo de' fiori, it's priced reasonably for the area, and it is clean. Our reservation worked really well, so I can't complain...

Reviews.Title: “Great room and value in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: ammatlanta
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here for 3 nights in March. A relatively quiet area of the city, but the restaurant just outside of the hotel does cause some noise at night. The room was clean, simple, and just what we needed. The staff was very helpful during our stay. My only slightly negative comment is that the breakfast was very basic and could have been a bit better - just the addition of some fresh fruit would have made a big difference. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Massimo and Walter”
Reviews.Author: toftwinther
Reviews.Content: The Americans find the rooms too small - maybe the Americans are too big... Anyway - these rooms are just fine after Italian standard, they are good after the normal standard in Rome, and they are excellent compared to the location you get here. Staying in the absolute hearth of Rome you really don't need a room... But if you insist, this is the place. And at the same time you get the fine service - not too close, not too cool - from Massimo (fan of Lazio) and Walter (fan of Roma). Never mind the fine breakfast, the good cleaning and even the two roofgardens - it is Massimo and Walter (and the location) that make Smeraldo the very best Smeraldo in Rome. That is why we are coming back - and for the football...of course

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value”
Reviews.Author: LeaveHome
Reviews.Content: The room is very clean and comfortable, the location is incredible, and the price is beyond reasonable. The front desk staff have been incredibly accommodating and we were not in the least bothered if they didn't smile when they graciously offered to refrigerate our bottle of wine. Do not miss either the cafe or the restaurant across the street! And yes, the shower is small, but it has been a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Expect Nothing”
Reviews.Author: mmlseptember
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 4 nights at the Hotel Smeraldo/Rome just recently. We would never return. Although I agree with the many reviews as to good price, central location, I hestiate to refer any traveler here because of the most fundamental business mistake. Rude, inconsiderate staff. I have been fortunate to travel a fair amount over the years. I have found that who greets you at the door will often provide the momentum for a terrific travel experience. I sympathize with anyone making a first time trip to Rome who encounters the Hotel Smeraldo staff. Expect nothing. Not even a smile, a thank you, Some will say, "Oh, it's just Italians..." Well, even in Rome, the hotel industry can, and should, compete. This hotel doesn't win.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, but the location makes the stay worth it”
Reviews.Author: SDTrav12
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is perfect...a 20 minute walk from the Colosseum, a 10 minute walk from the Pantheon; 2 minutes from the Area Sacra (where Julius Caesar was stabbed) and a short walk away from the Campo de' Fiori square. You're also very close to tram/bus stops (although a word of warning, it's usually fairly packed with people so making sure you can get on the right tram can be a challenge). A restaurant with terrific pasta is right across the lane and if you prefer it, a grocery store with helpful staff is practically around the corner. Room was fairly basic and the bed/mattress was lumpy and a bit uncomfortable. But the room was clean and the bathroom was clean/a good size; shower was pretty teeny though. The views from the upper patios were great; like looking at a postcard of the roofs and skyline of Rome. Price was reasonable for Rome. My biggest complaint about the hotel was noise; we found it extremely noisy at night. We were on the second floor, close to the elevator and it seemed that sound traveled easily through the corridors which made it sometimes hard to fall asleep. The staff was helpful if not always pleasant. Overall, despite any negatives, the location and cost won out overall and made it a worthwhile stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but basic”
Reviews.Author: BrennaBee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights the location was great but the rooms are quite basic, no frills. The rooms are small, flat screen tV, bathroom is tight. We stayed in a room that overlook Forno Riscoli so it was not too quiet at all. They have free internet downstairs and breakfast. If you are looking for something simple inexpensive then this is the place cannot beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Call if you have young children, elderly for a better rate”
Reviews.Author: gigianna
Reviews.Content: We had 3 adults (my husband, elderly Aunt, and I) and a 2 1/2 year old boy. If you book online, they will require you to get 2 rooms and my Aunt was not comfortable being alone. When we called, they accomodated us in a comfortable 3 bedroom for a reasonable rate.. it is worth the international call (just skype it). I highly recommend doing this when traveling with children, most Italian hotels were very accomodating with kids and families with elderly sharing a room.The front desk was efficient but not very cordial. They were not very helpful when my Aunt tried to call home with the calling card. Room was clean and sufficient. Location is good since you are near the Campo dei Fiori and Piazza Navona. Also, do not close the shutters at night or you may oversleep since the room is so dark... we almost had to pay an extra night! We also would have recommended to have the breakfast included next time simply for the convenience of a traveling young family... If you are arriving in Rome first and want to see everything without exhausting yourself fighting jet lag it is a good idea to have had this included for your first stop. Spend and Splurge on dinner and lunch in Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Good location near Campo Fiori”
Reviews.Author: luvspain69
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel in Rome. Our room was lovely but the room and bathroom were very, very small. They must have bigger rooms. The hotel was well maintained. Breakfast was included and was adequate. Our room was very clean. Hotel staff was helpful. I would stay here again but request a larger room. The hotel has an annex but we were in the main hotel. The location was perfect--close to bus lines and within an easy walk to Campo di Fiori, Piazza Navona etc. Inspite of our small room I would recommend this hotel. A good value hotel for the location.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Amanda G
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in a great location. Basic, clean, comfortable rooms for a good price

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Wulfruna42
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a large group about 7 years ago, and decided to revisit for a family break. Great decision. We were in the annex - two teenage boys in a twin room, next door to me and my husband. The staff were friendly and helpful, and very patient with my almost non-existant Italian! Breakfast set us up well for the day, and the hotel is just so central! We walked everywhere and had a fabulous return trip to Rome. The rooms aren't massive - but with all there is to see in Rome, who would stay inside for long?

Reviews.Title: “Good value and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ckassotis
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at around 9:30 AM and check-in had not started yet, so we left our luggage with the front desk and went out to wander the city a bit. After a while we headed back to the hotel and got checked in. If you were looking for a roomy hotel room, this was not for you. The room was quite tiny, with barely enough room for the two twin beds and a small table. The heat was constantly on, even when the heat was set to off and the A/C was switched on, which was a bit uncomfortable, but for two guys exploring the city, we did not particularly care what the room looked like. At night it got amazingly loud (still not entirely sure what was going on in the middle of the night) and quite warm, but as we were only there to sleep, I couldn’t complain. The hotel was right in the center of things, which was exactly what we wanted. The staff was very nice, always smiling and greeting you if they saw you, and did I mention the location was great? Would definitely recommend, but if you need a lot of room, or aren't using it just to catch a little sleep each night before you head out to explore again, you might try elsewhere. Me, I enjoyed it, despite it's quirks.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: BagLadies
Reviews.Content: A group of 8 ladies stayed at this hotel in September for two nights - should have been three but the Italians went on strike on our first day! The hotel were great in rearranging our booking and the minibus transfer from the hotel. The rooms were on the small side but for Rome this was the norm and we were only there to sleep! There is so much to do in Rome, we did not expect to spend very much time in the hotel at all. The rooms were spotlessly clean, we had four rooms in all, with separate locations within the hotel. I think that my only moan would be that I had the furthest to walk from the roof terrace, which gives wonderful views over the city and a chance to have a relaxing glass of wine before dinner (roof terrace closes at 7pm). The breakfast was continental but there was a wide selection. I would recommend this hotel as good value for money, very good location and helpful staff. The minibus driver on our way back to the airport was very informative about some sights in Rome that we passed but ran out of time. I would return to this hotel if I ever go the opportunity to visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Karen B
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in November 2011 and had a great time. The hotel room was a little small but very clean. The bathroom was a fairly decent size. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. They arranged for a car to take us to the Airport at the same cost as a mad taxi! The breakfast had plenty of choice - lots of lovely pastries along with toast, bread, cheese ham etc. The location of this hotel though is what makes this a fantastic place to stay - it is within easy walking distance of all the major sites, 20 mins to the Vatican and 15 mins the other way to the Colosseum. Really close to Piazza Navona and Campo D'Fiori where there are some great bars and restaurants. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Alexis726
Reviews.Content: The hotel was no frills, but great location and a great price. The staff was friendly and they have a secure room for storing your bags if you are too early to check in/out. The room was big enough for three, a little tight, but not unusual for European hotels. This hotel is right by the Campo di Fiori which is such a fun area. Everything in Rome is walkable and a number of great restaurants on the square are only a few minutes away. The hotel provides breakfast and internet, which are nice perks. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to need to be seen”
Reviews.Author: sallesweden
Reviews.Content: Smeraldo is situated close to all need to be seen thing in Rome. I was here for the second time and the hotel is good, clean and well managed. The breakfast is perhaps little simple but you have to remebe that this is a three stqar hotel. I cn recomend this hotel and as it also is close to Campo di fiori and Trastever you will be ale to fins both good bars and nice restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here earlier this month. The location is excellent -- but avoid this hotel like the plague! The staff raise the bar for rudeness, taking special care to make you sorry you chose to stay there. They get their attitude from the top of management. I had a chat with the manageress, pointing out that the smoke alarm in our room had no power and there was no fan, cooling or heat in our room for several nights running. She smugly assured me we were perfectly safe and commented that they were unable to get anyone out to repair the air conditioning. Get the picture? Rick Steves is WAY OFF on this recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Rome without a fortune”
Reviews.Author: ms mg
Reviews.Content: We seleted this hotel for its location & price, both very good in a very expensive city. The rooms are small, no smaller than many we have had in Europe, in a heavily taxed city.. We did have one of the less expensive rooms which just has room for one suitcase on the desk and one suitcase on the luggage rack, your carryon willl have to fit in the closet. We faced onto the street on the first floor, so had a nice view of the outdoor cafe and bakery across the street- potential noise for you light sleepers IF you leave the window OPEN- but there is A/C so you dont have to. We use sleep masks and earlpugs anyway, no problem.Your fellow tourists talking in the hall make a lot more noise than the people in the cafe, in my experience. The hotel has an elevator and a free lobby computer. The internet in your room costs a few euros, but one could pay for 2 days and get one day free IF you asked and paid in advance for that special - ask for that. Slow internet, so what. Yes, the shower is tiny- had had the exact same size in Paris tho- think the size encourages you to turn off the water while you soap up and thus save energy to heat the water and the water itself. The bathroom is an average size with limited counter space. This is an authentic big city hotel in a remodeled building- the kind of place I like, family run and not a Hilton or Holiday Inn. However, the hotel is spotlessly clean, the breakfast is a good Italian continental- several sliced cheeses and sliced turley or ham, along with the juice, fruit, cake,toast, sweet croissants, and good coffee. We would be pleased to stay here again. The Campo Fiori was lively and fun at night and a block or two back to the hotel. The front desk gave us 3 good dinner recommendations, funnily enough 2 of them were in the RIck Steves guidebook and very straighforward. Walter at the front desk was especially helpful with reservations at a Fish Restaurant nearby. Everyone was very professional and courteous and dignified, as befits hotel professionals, including the breakfast room ladies and the cleaners. Completely enjoyed our stay at the Smeraldo.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not impressed with hotel”
Reviews.Author: serohn
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I traveled to Rome for our third city in Italy, we knew we wanted to stay in the Campo di Fiori area or near Piazza Navona. This hotel is situated on a very small, cute street that is less than 5 minutes walking distance from both of those areas. We also walked to every hot spot in the entire city from our hotel. The longest walk was about minutes one way, and that was to the Colloseum. The location of this hotel was fantastic. The hotel itself, however, was not so fantastic. The room was unbearably small, and the only window we had faced a brick wall. It was pitch black in the room unless we had the lights on. Now we literally were only in the room to shower and sleep, so it wasn't such a huge deal. The bathroom was fine. The breakfast was average, but included in the package. The employees at the front desk were somewhat curt and unwelcoming. And finally, the place smelled like smoke in the hallways. Either they still allowed smoking in the hotel, or people smoked right outside of the air unit outside of the building. As non-smoker, this was a killer turn off.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Central Rome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: joedvet
Reviews.Content: Good central Hotel. It was nice and quiet. Had a nice breakfast too. Room was typical of european rooms, a bit on the small size but adaquate. Good view from balcony too. Only negative: smallest shower I think I ever had in a room. Really tiny, even my wife at 5 foot 2 remarked that she could not shave her legs as she could not bend at all. Otherwise, great. They do charge for internet but they have a free computer downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but nice, fun location”
Reviews.Author: ranger1958
Reviews.Content: Our room was small but clean. When closed, windows did a pretty good job of blocking out street noise. Breakfast is a nice addition, as breakfast (beyond a coffee and pastry) is a little hard to find. We asked the front desk for a taxi to airport and they gave us a car service for the same price which was nice! Really good restaurant just across the street (Trattoria Moderne). If you are walking (as we did, from the train station) I would recommend calling them to ask for directions as it is on a tiny street in a maze of tiny streets and is hard to find using a city map.

Reviews.Title: “tucked down ancient street in heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Gail050
Reviews.Content: Centrally located down a narrow ancient street near Campo de Fiori, this small hotel is perfect for walking to the Forum, Colosseum and Pantheon. Rooms are small but clean, breakfast is very nice, and staff all helpful. Local bread,cheese, and wine markets nearby - great for getting a snack to eat on the roof top deck at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, helpful, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: passport2earth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend of sightseeing, and was very pleased. The hotel is in a great location- highly central, but tucked away from the noise of Rome's traffic. I highly recommend the hotel's breakfast, as it is hard to find a solid morning meal in Europe sometimes. The staff is very sweet, and there is free internet use in the lobby. The rooms are a little small, but well-kept, clean and very comfortable- I slept better than I usually do in my own bed. The shower was a dream compared to most European water pressure. Loved it and will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: ““Great hotel, highly recommended!”””
Reviews.Author: annaf99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the hotel for 5 nights during our vacation to Rome in the beginning of October. Location is amazing,,, walking distance to many of the major points of interest, such as Piazza Nevona, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Campo di Fiori, Piazza Venezia and Trastevere. Close to transportation and great restaurants. Good trattorria and bar are right outside the door of the hotel . Room was not big, but comfortable and very clean. The roof terraces are fantastic. It was so nice to sit there in the evenings with glass of wine, looked over the rooftops and shared traveling tips with other guests. The breakfast was very simple, but ok . We found the staff there very friendly and helpful. I will highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning to visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been happier...”
Reviews.Author: jim85308
Reviews.Content: My wife had been here before and wanted to share Rome with me. She was a little embarrassed to take me to a "3 star" hotel that seemed cheap by comparison to other options. I couldn't have been happier. The Smeraldo is a perfect mix of a respectably modern hotel in a charming authentic Italian neighborhood. For better of for worse a lot of the little eateries and shops we frequented around the Smeraldo spoke little English but were patient and understanding of us. After a week there we finally started to figure out the procedures. The little bar across the street "Bar Rossana" was a great place to grab a wine or americano at the bar or sit out front and watch the crazy little cars, scooters and local pedestrians scurry about. They have great prices on small daily essentials (wine, espresso and bottled water.) The hotel staff is friendly, speak english well and informative. From the hotel we walked everywhere we went and there is little we did not see. The transfer from hotel to airport is fair at 45 euro per couple. We will return to Rome and we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: plstrobel
Reviews.Content: Great place, wonderful staff, great location and they have two roof top patio areas that you can sit and have some wine. Only issue was that the air conditioning was not the most efficient. Good restaurant across the street and several within a short walk, ask the desk and they will assist.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: lngokray
Reviews.Content: Smeraldo was fantastic. Great location to most of the sites in Rome. A main bus terminal within a block. The desk was very helpful with any of my questions, train schedules, etc. The rooms are small but clean and a nice brekfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: scrimshaw2
Reviews.Content: Second visit to this hotel, Location is ideal to all major sights. Price does not break the bank. Well run place...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: AJM012
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights this year and it was a dream vacation for us. The location was ideal- very close to Campo de Fiori (about a block) and a couple of blocks south of Piazza Navona and the Pantheon. About a 5min walk to the Capitoline Hill. Nice restaurant across the street and a Forno for dinner on our terrace. We were one of the few lucky ones to have our own private terrace and although small, our room was very clean and quiet at night with the windows closed and the air conditioning turned on. The staff without exception were friendly and helpful. It was everything as promised and we would be back in a flash if we had any vacation time left.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Smeraldo”
Reviews.Author: Christine L
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Smeraldo was fantastic. Walter at the desk was helpful with any questions and a great conversationalist. Our room was very comfortable, air conditioned and there is an elevator which was great. The hotel is located within walking distance of many of the major points of interest, such as Campo di Fiori, Piazza Nevona, Pantheon and Trevi Fountain. Also, there is a bar and a trattorria right outside the door of the hotel. The roof garden at the hotel had an incredible view of nearby Roman homes and domes and provided a relaxing venue to sip wine after a long day of touring the cobblestone streets. My husband and I would definitely return to the Smeraldo in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a decent price.”
Reviews.Author: Bepumade
Reviews.Content: The Smeraldo is in a great location for those that are looking to walk to most of the sites in Rome. It has a fantastic bakery right around the corner to the left (when you walk out of the hotel), and a tasty restaurant right across the street. The staff is friendly and helpful. We especially liked the small terrace at the top of the hotel. The breakfast is typical of what you find at a hotel in Europe, as well as the room size.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Pia23
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the middle of locals and close to Trastevere & many other key areas. We slept in the annex although we requested a room in the main site. But it was not bad at all. The room was small and clean. TV and air conditioning working. A small fridge would have been useful. The bathroom was ok - only some mold on the roof. The walls were not very thick. You could very well hear the neighbor trying to make the toilet work during the night. The reception personnel spoke good english and gave the needed directions. The restaurant across the street was good, and there is a wonderful little bakery next to the hotel annex. The breakfast was ok but included canned fruit instead of fresh which is a pity in such a country. And the personnel there could have been a bit friendlier and not show their boredom with customers that clearly.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: NMmommynurse
Reviews.Content: First time in Rome and several people had recommended we stay in this area, so I went w/ this Rick Steve's recommendation. I was pleasantly surprised by this very nice and simple little hotel. I met my 60ish mother in Rome and we stayed for 5 nights. We did request a room in the main hotel and not the annex on the 1st floor (so 1 flight up in Europe). The room was small w/ an even smaller bathroom, but comfortable. I had just come from what was supposed to be a 3 star hotel in Bologna which was really grim (basically felt like sleeping in an ashtray), so I was nervous about what Rome had in store. This place was CLEAN!! and quiet which is what we wanted after a day of sightseeing. It's hardly luxurious, but I managed to get an extra pillow when requested and the air conditioning worked well. I found the front desk staff helpful and friendly enough. They gave us correct directions and bus routes when asked, called taxis, etc. The bedside light never got fixed, but I didn't push it either. We found breakfast very adequate and low key. I wish we'd had a small fridge to keep water and stuff b/c it was REALLY hot while we were visiting, but for the price I think it is a reallly good deal.

Reviews.Title: “best location”
Reviews.Author: passaporta
Reviews.Content: spent 4 nights here & loved the location our room was small but very comfortable large bathroom great breakfast very friendly & helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Danish32
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful vacation in Rome. And I can only recommend Smeraldo Hotel. The location is so great. We were able to walk everythere (yes - my feet really hurts now). There are lot of shops, small cafés and restaurants in the neighbourhood. The Campo de Fiori is only 5 minuttes walk away. The rooms are very small, but nice and clean. The roof terraces are fantastic - especially the upper terrrace. It was so nice to sit here in the evenings with a drink, a glass of redwine, some good cheese or whatever and look over the rooftops. You are free to bring you own stuff upthere. It was also very nice to meet other guests up here and sharing travelling tips. The breakfast was very simple, but ok - would have loved to have some fresh fruit... We never had any problems with rude staff, they were always very polite and helpfull. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice location”
Reviews.Author: galsmiley1971
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for 4 nights during our European vacation. It was centralized to the sights. Very cute area. The hotel staff were extremely helpful. It was very clean. We slept well. They had the best continental breakfast of our trip. Would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: teleprompt
Reviews.Content: Many thanks to the staff at the Smeraldo Hotel who were very kind to my pregnant wife and my father who was ill. This is a great little hotel in a superb location. Excellent value for money. We'll be definitely be staying in the Smeraldo next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!! Great location”
Reviews.Author: giome
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel!! there are many little restaurants, shopping and a market right around the corner. The rooms and elevators are very small. The bedroom, the bathroom is very clean and the bed is comfortable. The breakfast they provide is very good too.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: psyied
Reviews.Content: Since we had very limited time in Rome, it was important for us to stay in close proximity to the sites and hotel Smeraldo was perfect!!! We were able to walk to trevi fountain, the vatican, the colosseum, everything! Plus there is a great coffee shop across the street and the hotel serves breakfast. Although the shower was a little small, the rest of the accommodations were great! A/C, ample bed size, TV, safe, location, friendly staff, quiet at night, and a free computer on site. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Smeraldo Hotel Rome Italy --- Best stay for price - Location perfect”
Reviews.Author: Traveling00Man
Reviews.Content: For the Money you can't beat it. I priced all over Rome until I came across This hotel which was centrally placed to attractions .From the steps to the Vatican was very close to the river and streat vendors. (evening). Also found a streat market(open early morning with fresh fruits) and a grocery store within 3 mins of hotel.. The staff is great always helpfull The Rooms was nice but simple and the bathroom was tight (thats why I didn't give it a 5 star). The room comes with breakfest which was a nice way to start off the morning because buying food at any resteraunt is expensive in my opintion. IE 38 euros for two pizzas and three beer or $50 usa.. My suggestion go to the grocery store and put yourself a picnic basket together. Bottle of wine two beers Large bottle of coke, Soft persuto, cheese, cookies fresh bread 15 euros P.S. large bottle of water 2 ltr was LESS THAN 1 EURO. I wish someone would have mentioned this to me because I figured this out with only two days left in my vacation. I would definetly stay there again.. Almost forgot there is a wonderfull patio on top of the hotel You can use for whatever. maybe have a drink or picnic evening cocktail? Have fun Best Regards Ron

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay and would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: cl1971
Reviews.Content: Small but very clean. Central enough for all of the main attractions to be in walking distance. Staff were very friendly and helpful.If we return to Rome in the future we would definitely stay here again. Local restaurants very expensive and don't really offer good value for money so a good idea to shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location... but not the friendliest staff!'”
Reviews.Author: Dora_Ireland_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is great - close to Campo di Fiori, Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, only 10 minutes walk from Via del Corso - we literally walked everywhere! The room was clean and well equipped (towels, shampoo etc) and it was a bonus to have a few English speaking channels! The air conditioning worked well and can be controlled in the room, although it wasn't as warm as Rome can be on our visit. The major negative for this hotel were the staff. I completely agree with earlier comments about the breakfast staff - they appear to despise their job. The front desk were not much better -on our arrival we were 'greeted' by an abrupt man, who told my friend she looked very unhappy. He failed to give us any information about the location of the hotel or ammenities available or payment for the room. When I asked if he needed my credit card he responded by saying 'I would have asked for it I needed it'! We found him very rude and following this his presence on the front desk was unpleasant to say the least. We didn't even want to book our taxi to the airport while he was working. The other desk staff were adequate, but not friendly. This was unfortunate as the hotel was nice otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location; comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: ejkb
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel recently. I had originally booked another hotel, but that was cancelled on us a week before our arrival date. I did some quick reviews, including the Rick Steves Book, called Smeraldo, and booked the room. We actually were given a triple, so the room as well as the bathroom was probably larger than the typical double room. We purchased wifi for three days and it worked well. A/C worked well, lots of hot water and good water pressure....all musts for us! Breakfast was more than adequate with cereals, yogurt, fruit, pastries, juices, and really good coffee. Staff was very helpful and gave us good directions with a smile! The location is central to everything - although we found Rome to be very walkable from a number of different areas. We liked the intimate feel of this neighborhood with the narrow streets and a more local feeling. There is a deli across the street that serves great food to eat there or for take away. We ate there several times, ordering different homemade items, including pizza and hot and cold pasta dishes. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamSue074
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here back in April 2011, but did not review at that time. It came highly recommended for its position and on that we were not disappointed. In 5 minutes you can be in the lovely Campo di Fiori, a lively square at night with some nice bars. A further 5 minutes gets you to the Piazza Navarona, a bustling square which we came upon unexpectedly and it was a lovely surprise. The rooms are spotless and the towels were changed every day. It was nice to be able to sit on the roof terrace when we returned from our sightseeing and there was a small bar right outside as the hotel only has a vending machine for cold drinks. Breakfast however is a poor selection which becomes boring after 2 days, it needs to be livened up with a bit of variety and some fresh fruit. We were advised to go out for breakfast but they would not offer a 'no breakfast ' option. All the staff were very helpful..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: denisi11
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on the Rick Steve's guidebook, the location is superb, very centrally located in the Campo di Fiori area. Only a few blocks away from Piazza Navona, The Pantheon, less than a block away from Largo Argentina... I basically walked everywhere. The hotel itself is small, clean, the staff was friendly, as a solo traveler (first solo experience) I felt very comfortable. My room had a small balcony overlooking the terraces and the street, where I sat and enjoyed the sights while reviewing my itinerary for the next day. The biggest gripe I had was that the elevator was broken for the majority of my stay, I was on the fourth floor; needless to say, the trip upstairs was quite painful. The breakfast -which was included- did just fine, good coffee and pastries. Smeraldo was a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Smeraldo - Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: muisc00man
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel -- the staff is wonderfull, price includes breakfest, within waking distance of many attractions and the local flea market; where you can buy fruits and some other touristy things. It's less then 1/4 mile from the river there are many vendors there along the river if your into that kinda thing. Don't forget to haggle on the price. Also would like to say Taxi was 12 euro 17 usa from train station to hotel for 3 people. Don't let anyone fool you. Had taxi drivers asking for 35euros 49 USA be patient and you will save money. Ron

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, lots of stairs!!”
Reviews.Author: MTMama1960
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 8 when we visited and had 2 singles and 2 triples. The rooms were great, quiet, and clean. The hair dryer in our room didn't work, but I have learned to bring my own with me when traveling anywhere. Make sure you have a round two-prong adapter for electronic devices of any kind. The showers were small, in the corner of the bathroom, but it's Europe! If you have problems with stairs - be warned. There is a small elevator that reportedly holds three people, but you have to get very cozy to fit. One person with luggage fills it. Otherwise, there are stairs. The breakfast room is in the basement, down more stairs. We loved the location of the hotel, even though it was hard to find initially. We were in short walking distance to Campo di Fiore, Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, the Forum and a little bit further to the Vatican. We were close to places to eat - right across the "alley" and around the corner - shopping and sights. The staff was helpful, but a little detached, not quite as friendly as I would have hoped. We'll definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The location is great, Staff not as much.”
Reviews.Author: mackenziemiller
Reviews.Content: Hotel Smeraldo was one of three hotels at which my husband and I stayed during our recent trip to Italy. We stayed in two different rooms on different legs of our trip, and the first was very small, while the second was larger and more comfortable, but both were fine. The location of the hotel is great, central to the attractions of Rome and directly across from an amazing restaurant, a bakery, and a cafe. The rooftop garden is also wonderful. The staff, while moderately helpful, is not friendly and in fact seems to be bothered by requests most of the time. While I had read that this was an issue, on our last day my husband received treatment that crossed the line into rudeness, which started off our last day in Rome very badly. Overall a reasonably good hotel with a fabulous location and garden, but don't expect much out of the staff. Also, wi-fi is not only expensive (3 Euro a day), but only can be used by one device, and local calls to make dinner reservations are also at an additional cost.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: arcoccia
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd stay at the Smeraldo and as always we have found it to be just as before a good hotel at a good price. We travel every year across Europe, and this hotel for the price is as good as any! The rooms can't have very much light because of where the building sits,but this in the heart of medival Rome,a short walk form the Pantheon and many other sites,so I can turn on a light! The staff at the breakfast buffet ,were not Miss sunshine,but they were professional, helpful and kept the buffet full,what more can a guest ask! We spoke with the staff one morning and they mentioned tripadvisor and the review about the service,the fact that this bothered them should tell you about how they care about the service they provide. Maybe this hotel is not for everyone,but it is definately for us!

Reviews.Title: “I have very mixed feelings about this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: lolo51
Reviews.Content: I will begin with the positive, which is very little. We drove our car from Florence to Rome (a mistake we will NEVER make again!) and decided on the drive that we wanted to go directly to the Hertz Return at the airport to return the car. Originally, my husband was going to drop me at the hotel, then return the car. Words cannot describe how glad we were to NOT have done that as this hotel is in a very obscure location and we would probably still be driving around trying to find it. I digress - we called the hotel and asked if they could help us get a ride from the airport to the hotel. No problem, he couldn't have been more helpful. Best 50 euros ($75 US) we spent on the trip. I will say, however, that the initial contact on the phone was less than hopeful as communication was a bit challenging, but once he found our name on the roster, things got better. That's the positive. I agree wholeheartedly with the other reviews and all their criticisms. This hotel is wildly overpriced and the one reviewer must have had the same room as we did as our bathroom also smelled like urine. The room was adequate, at best. Dreary furnishings, etc. Bed was OK, and we really didn't complain of the room's size as we had just spent 10 days in France where the rooms barely hold the bed! The one gentleman at the front desk was nice, but there was one who was quite abrupt and often rude. We were on the 4th floor right next to the "terrace". I don't know what views the terrace provided, but it certainly was not the skyline of Rome! And I also don't know where the wine glasses, candles, etc., came from. There was no service on the terrace. It was small, and frankly annoying being so close to our room #406. The voices carried and we were tired after a long day of touring the city. Other than the urine smell in the bathroom, I really can't complain about the housekeeping. They changed our towels every day, which surprised us. We travel all the time both on business and pleasure, and we were shocked that water conservation was not considered. The only truly friendly employee of the hotel was a young man in the housekeeping department who greeted us every morning with a smiling face. We appreciated that as it all changed as you descended into the bowels of the hotel to the dining room. That is, without a doubt, the most unhappy, unfriendly, unsmiling, miserable staff of women I have ever encountered in our travels. No smile, no good morning, no nothing but glares. You were asked your room number, which baffled us as the buffet was included, and then the back was turned on you and that was the last dealings you had with the most miserable woman on the planet. Don't ask for a cappucino - the look you'll get - phew! And they are terrible to boot. The buffet was standard European fare, nothing to write home about. Oh yeh, this was the only hotel we stayed at on our three week trip that charged for internet use - 10 euros!! All in all, we will never return to this hotel. Poor location, really, all things considered, and way, way overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: comingtoyourcity
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd year in a row our group has stayed here and it’s mainly because of the amazing location 2 minutes away from Campo di Fiori and the price. This isn’t the greatest hotel but for the price and location, it works. The people at the front desk are okay – some are very helpful and some not so much. The rooms fit 1, 2 or 3 people. The beds are good – not great. Each room does have air conditioning, which is a plus. The walls in the room as thin and you can hear everything that happens in the bathroom. We have a bunch of 17 year olds in our group. The breakfast has a lot to offer and we had a lot of boys in our group and they like to eat and liked the selection and quantity available. The wi-fi isn't worth it and didn't work well. We’ll most likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Anonois
Reviews.Content: This was the most depressing and yet overpriced hotel I've stayed in any where in Europe (or Africa or Asia) for that matter. It was dingy, dirty, uncomfortable, cramped, And noisy. The beds were like cardboard, the rooms were not just plain, but grubby, and the staff unhelpful. The price was only 9 euros less than am excellent 4 star hotel. There is no reason to stay here. Save yourself. There are many charming places in Rome, but this is definitely not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Clean-But Most Likely won't go back.”
Reviews.Author: Darlenehixon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and was located in a great location in the Pantheon area of Rome. Very accessible restaurants and wonderful little boutique shopping, near the nightlife of the Pantheon. Fabulous location. The hotel rooms however are overly small, very dark. Wi-fi is charged there per device, which is terribly goofy and ridiculous. Why not charge three euros more for the room and make it an amenity of the room. The breakfast was very good in a very nice dining room in the basement of the hotel. This hotel was not bad...it was just ok. We will most likely try to find another hotel in the same area next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good room for the price”
Reviews.Author: SARAHMEMPHISTN
Reviews.Content: Three of us spent one night at Smeraldo Hotel Rome. We were pleased with the room . It was a small room but we were in Rome! The location was great for what we wanted to see. The staff was very polite and accommodating. The breakfast was very generous with a lot of variety. We used the airport pickup service and it was money well spent . We would recommend this hotel to a friend and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EuropeLover1891
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is wonderful and the staff most helpful. Our room was just as it looked on the internet. There were wonderful places to eat and outdoor markets just around the corner. We were close to almost all the major sites and when we needed directions or transportation the staff helped with everything. On the day of our departure I spilled watermelon juice on my outer shirt. One of the cleaning staff took me to the roof and washed out the stain and pressed my shirt. Rome was amazing!! I wish we would have had more than 2 days in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & price”
Reviews.Author: 4tennessee
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recommended to us by friends who had stayed there previously. Rooms in Rome can be very expensive & the Smeraldo is a reasonable price for Rome and the location is excellent. The staff was very helpful. We arrived with a good case of jet lag and they were very helpful and patient. The hotel arranged pick up at the airport and they were waiting for us when we arrived. After a long flight, we really appreciated the ease of having someone waiting to take us to the hotel. Breakfast was also included which was a plus. I would certainly stay at the Smeraldo again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, everything I had hoped”
Reviews.Author: no3putt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location to walk to all the many sights of Rome. In three days, we walked to the Vatican(longest, maybe 25 min) to Spanish Steps, Colosseum, Trastevere Piazza Navona, Campo di Fiori(very close)and points in between. The rooms are very clean, compact and the bathroom beautiful but tiny shower. We found the staff to be polite, efficient and very helpful. Our room on the 3rd floor faced out to the street and although it was fun to look out and watch the activity, sleeping was almost impossible as the noises on the narrow stone streets all move upward. So we inquired about moving to a room in the back and fortunately one was available on our last night. The staff were gracious and offered to move our luggage. This room was 107, had a small window into a tiny quiet courtyard and we had a very peaceful sleep. The breakfast was a good offering of continental style items, great for us but don't expect bacon and eggs. Overall, I would certainly recommend this hotel, good value, clean and terrific location. We loved our visit to Rome and Smeraldo fit the bill perfectly. Don't forget the rooftop terrace, not fancy but a quiet spot for a glass of wine and view the skyline. Great cafe across from front door and we had a terrfic meal at Le Maschere around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Our Place in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Vasio
Reviews.Content: The Smeraldo hotel is located in our favorite section of Rome near our favorite restaurants. It's not showy, fancy, luxurious or even pretty. But, damn they are priced right, and smack in the middle of the best part of Rome (in our opinion). The breakfast is forgettable, so forget it. Go out and explore your part of town for morning coffee. The hotel offers a taxi service to the airport, it came very late. The driver went 100 mph to get us to the airport. It was cheaper than a regular cab. The Best part of this hotel: Rosicoli is right downstairs. If you CAN afford a fancy hotel in Rome, god bless. The fancy place will set you back a ton of euro. Hotel Smeraldo is affordable and can't be beat for anybody who doesn't have cash to burn. I'd rather spend my money on more food! PS. they have a roof terrace with great views of a nearby church. Perfect for drinking wine and chilling after a day of pounding the pavement in the eternal city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Again”
Reviews.Author: MalvernGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 years ago same time and was just as good this time. Great location in old Rome, friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms, comfortable bed, decent breakfast, 2 nice rooftop areas. All at a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay at the Smeraldo”
Reviews.Author: readyinredding
Reviews.Content: I don't write a lot of reviews but felt I had to write this one because of the negitive reviews I have read about this hotel. We chose this hotel as it was recommended by family who stayed there several years ago. After reading some of the reviews, we almost decided to cancel and book elsewhere. Well, we are very happy we did not. We were satisfied with our 5 night stay. 1. As mentioned the rooms are small. We were traveling with another couple and theirs was more spacious so not all rooms are the same. We were in the annex and on the 4th floor which had only the two rooms which was nice. Even though our room was on the small side, our closet was large enough that we unpacked and had room to put our suitcase away on the top shelf. The room was very clean and updated. 2. The location is terrific. It is very centrally located and we walked everywhere except to the Vatican, but that is doable as our family walked to it. It is in a wonderful neighborhood with several piazzas nearby and lots of restaurants and shopping. 3. The main reason I am writing is to address the statements about the staff. Our first impressions were that they were reserved, but polite. During our 5 day stay we had reason to have contact with them for several reasons and had very satisfactory results. My friend dropped 10 postcards into their mailbox in the lobby. The next day she realized she had not put enough postage on them. She explained this to the desk and they went out of their way to track down the cards (which had left the lobby but were still in the possession of the hotel management at another location) and get them back for my friend. Another day our camera had stopped working and we asked about where to purchase a new one. The gentleman behind the desk took the time to think about where to send us that would sell us a new camera at a reasonable price and gave us directions on how to get there. They also helped us find a place to have laundry done without once saying we should just have the hotel do it. One evening we were sitting in the lobby doing e-mail when a woman appeared (in her robe and slippers) with a glass in her hand. With hand on hip she said "what is wrong with you Italians, I can't get ice anywhere in this country!" The clerk walked around the desk, took her glass and went across the street to a cafe to get ice for her. When he returned he said "madame, this is the way of Italy. When I visit America, I do not expect everything to be done for me the same as at home" Well, good for him! My point is, maybe it is people with attitudes like hers that causes the staff to act less than friendly. I am not saying everyone acts this way and in fact know it is the minority, but none the less, we do reap what we sow. 4. The breakfast was more than adequate, with a good selection. The breakfast room is very pleasant. We stayed in 9 different locations on our month long trip and this was one of our more satisfactory breakfasts. We would not hesitate to book this hotel again if we should return to Rome. The rate was reasonable and we were happy with our stay-AND the staff!!

Reviews.Title: “So-So Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A3Porsche
Reviews.Content: The hotel was pretty average. Cramped bedrooms and bathrooms. Breakfast wasn't so great either. Staff wasn't the friendliest we encountered on the trip. But it was decent price in a GREAT location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Keegan_HCWI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Smeraldo Hotel for 5 nights while visiting Rome. The location was perfect. Close to the bus system, the Pantheon and shopping. The room itself was clean and comfortable, although on the small side. The continental breakfast had a good variety of pastries, cheeses, cereal, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing... bug alert!”
Reviews.Author: cjwms71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the recommendation a friend who was a longtime resident of Rome and a frequent traveler. He said the hotel was wonderfully located--which it is--and that it was a great value. Charming, family run, with a friendly staff. We booked a room for three nights. Alas, that was not our experience at all. Quite the opposite. The staff was not friendly or helpful, even when we presented ourselves to them after our first night with the tell tale signs of bed bug bites on our bodies. To be fair, we cannot be certain that the bites we had were from bed bugs, as we did not see any in the room during our brief stay there. That said, the bites were text book, and they appeared after our only night in the hotel. We quickly decided to leave the hotel, but we also reported the issue to the staff. They offered to move us to a new room, but that was it. We checked out, but they charged us 50% of the room rate for the second night, and offered no refund for the first. They later agreed to refund the second night, but I have yet to see the refund posted to our credit card. Avoid the Smeraldo.

Reviews.Title: “Well located dump”
Reviews.Author: Josl71
Reviews.Content: Avoid this place if you are not a local. Every single staff member was rude to all tourists, we were greeted with someone demanding an explanation about why we hadn't checked our email in the last few days (I don't know, maybe because I'm on vacation??), the keys to our room were almost thrown at us, the room stunk of sewage and they refused to give us another one even though they were not full. We learned this the next day when they were shocked to see my wife and I leaving first thing in the morning... That's when they mentioned they could have moved us the night before, which of course made things worse. It is supposed to be non-smoke and the next day we overheard another guest complaining about cigar smoke entering her room all night. The only thing they have going is the centric location, but overall, it's really not worth it. AVOID!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: RamblersOhio
Reviews.Content: We felt in the center of everything we wanted to see. It's just a short walk to Campo di Fiore and near the bridge to Trastavere. The staff was helpful, but don't try to ask them questions when they are checking in people and checking out others (early in the morning, generally). During the day, when they have a bit of down time is the best time to ask. We stayed a week, but didn't go up to the rooftop area until the last day--that was a mistake. Do it early and often. The worker in charge kicked us out a bit early (7:45 p.m. instead of 8 p.m.), but that was OK too. Yes, rooms are small, but why stay in the room? Breakfast was standard OK. Be sure if you take the hotel-recommended taxi to the airport that the drivers knows you know it should be 45 Euro. Ours had the meter on and it ended up being 48. Cabs from the airport at the stand are perfect (Rome City cabs) and it was 40 euro, which was less than we thought it was.

Reviews.Title: “Best Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Kelloll
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hotel Smeraldo was very accommodating. We connected especially with one gentleman who was on the front desk evenings during our stay. The hotel was clean, our room was spotless every day, fresh towels daily, and the complimentary breakfast very good. Our room was ready when we arrived at 9:30 AM so we could check in and start our exploration of Rome early. The hotel was in a very convenient location and we could walk everywhere. Only downside - our room was located on the street and was a little noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ConnieGroh
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, front desk service was sometimes great and sometimes not so friendly. Breakfast was very good. The internet service was extra and is per PERSON not per room, so if you have more than one person, you will have to share a computer or pay for more than one.

Reviews.Title: “Desk service is poor, location good, clean.”
Reviews.Author: DontwaitMn
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Oct 2010. Multiple people at the front desk were not helpful in any way. I had written hem about getting soccer game tickets prior to arrival. They said they can help when we arrive. After arrival I asked about this when I arrived and someone said I couldn't get them. Then another desk person later said I could just go to the stadium. After arrival at the stadium I found out that they did not sell them there and I had to travel to another locaton about 4 KM away. I wish they would have said your on your own and they have no idea. I would have been more prepared. Every time I had a question about transportation or a question about the city I would get a short and generally unhelpful response. We also had a plugged toilet that I could not fix. I mentioned this to the staff and they seemed to get pissed off. If they could just give me a plunger, I could have solved it. The rest of hotel features were adequate to good. The breakfast was basic, nothing special but did the job. The location was very good. The room was well cleaned. The rooftop garden we went up to but never really used.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Cozy, Quiet, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Mary4343
Reviews.Content: Hotel Smeraldo met our needs. It was very clean and quiet. The room was small, but we were sight-seeing all day. The tiny bathroom was recently renovated... covered in marble. The free breakfast was EXCELLENT. Our twin beds were firm. We discovered the best bakery in Rome, just a few steps from the hotel entrance. The city bus and hop-on-hop-off tourist bus was three short blocks away. The hotel is One hop-on-hop-off bus stop from St. Peter's Basicila and TWO stops from the entrance to the Vatican Museum. Hotel Smeraldo sells tickets to the hop-on- hop-off bus. I've been to Rome four times and found many hotels cost a lot more than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: StacySeattle
Reviews.Content: I know Rome pretty well and knew exactly what area I wanted to stay in - near the Campo de' Fiori. This hotel is about a 2 minute walk to the Campo, and therefore also very near everything else you'd want to see in central Rome. I'm a walker so I considered everything "walking distance". The hotel and room were very clean. The cleaning staff do a great job and I saw them working really hard every time I walked into and out of the hotel. The front desk staff were for the most part very cold and unfriendly. During my 4 day stay I only got one smile from them. Some people say Italians are unfriendly, but that's just not true... I've stayed at plenty of pensiones and small hotels with extremely friendly and welcoming staff. They helped me with questions I had and were efficient with my check-in/check-out, so no complaints about the service itself. They have an elevator but don't count on it functioning if you really need it. 3 of the 4 days I was there it was out of service for at least part of the day. Not a big deal for me personally, but it might be an important point for elderly or disabled travelers. Breakfast was minimal, but the coffee was excellent. I usually supplemented with fresh fruit from the market on my way out to go exploring. The room was perfectly fine size-wise. As many previous posters have stated, you're in the central part of a European city so you shouldn't be expecting a large room. Besides, you really shouldn't be lingering in your room while in Rome anyway! The only negative I have about the room - and this isn't uncommon in Europe either - is that the bed was insanely hard. I like a hard mattress, but this felt like I was laying on a piece of plywood. Solution? Walk tons during the day, eat a large & lengthy dinner, enjoy a lot of fabulous Italian wine... and you'll be able to sleep anywhere! :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tgfield
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the great location. It is in a nice central location and we were easily able to walk around and see all the sites, even is in walking distance to the Vatican. Another perk of this location is it is near Piazza Navona and Campo de Fiori which are good places to grab dinner or drinks. As a lot of reviews say, yes, the rooms are very small. We could not open both of our suitcases, but this didn't bother us at all, you have to realize this is a hotel in a large European city. The rooms were very clean and quiet. The hotel staff was fine. They maybe werent as personable as some other places we stayed in italy, but they were efficient and helpful enough when we asked for assistance. Overall good place, we would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, awesome.”
Reviews.Author: MinIdaho
Reviews.Content: Here is my short to the point review: Eat breakfast next door at bar rosanna. Best coffee ever. Rome is a large city the rooms will be smaller than you are use to but that is part of the fun. Go get your lunch at campo every morning it is only a 2 minute walk and a great experiance. For people that complain about internet access, you are on vacation. If you really need it ask for it. They are not opposed to it but they hate all the forms they have to fill out. As one person said it is the management. Bottom line: great location, clean, awesome locals and you will want to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ManByTheLee
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location on a quiet street, two minutes from Campo de Fiori. We had a three bedded room for the two of us so the additional bed gave us plenty of space for our cases. The room and bathroom were very clean. Breakfast was ok but to be fair there was a good selection of food and you could eat as much as you like. The staff were very helpful. I look forward to staying there again

Reviews.Title: “the location was great..”
Reviews.Author: Sutanuka
Reviews.Content: The rooms were a bit smaller than what we'd imagined however the location was excellent. It was so convenient. The rooms were clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very good position and clean roooms”
Reviews.Author: bluff42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for my mother and fathers 70th birthday trip to Rome. The hotel was very well located for all the sites and although the rooms were compact they were clean and tidy and perfect for the job. There was a little roof terrace where you could sit out and enjoy a glass of wine before dinner. Most of the staff were very helpful apart from one man who was a bit grumpy, but then this is Italy ! The only disappointing thing wsa that the wi-fi was only available in the lobby seating area and not in the rooms. I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gypsyontour
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Smeraldo Hotel in August and it was great. I would highly recommend staying here. The price was reasonable for Rome, the location was fantastic close to Plaza Campo de Fiori, Jewish Ghetto and Trastevere. This area is fantastic for restaurants and nightlife and because taxis cost more in the evening its better to stay in this area at night and visit the other places during the day (everything is still walking distance) The hotel's wireless wasn't very good and it wasn't free, but there are several options nearby. The breakfast was good (although the coffee could be better) but overall the rooms were clean, air conditioning worked well and the staff were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: BuzzDR
Reviews.Content: Pros: The location is great and the cost was very reasonable for Rome. The lobby and the rooms were very clean, and the air conditioning worked very well. Our room was very quiet, with no street noise or noise from other customers. Cons: The staff was not helpful and seemed annoyed when we asked them questions (this was in sharp contrast to everywhere else we stayed in Italy). The included breakfast was average (the coffee, in a country of wonderful coffee, was awful). The beds were not great.

Reviews.Title: “Good value centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Bartramboy
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for Rome and great location. Room size was adequate and appeared to be recently refurbished. Breakfast was standard continental fare however with undrinkable coffee. The elderly lady helping out in the morning is the star of the establishment. Downside was staff at reception, who on the whole are a miserable bunch, reluctant to smile and when asking them for info you always had the feeling that you were interupting them, as opposed to them being there to help you. I also asked them for the nearest internet cafe, they gave me vague directions and declined to tell me that there was a computer (pre-paid cards only) hidden away in the lobby, which I discovered on our departure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location at a terrific cost”
Reviews.Author: PeterKalish
Reviews.Content: We traveled to the hotel from the airport. The logistics couldn't be easier. We took a train to the Trestevere station and a tram to the Argentina stop. The hotel was two short blocks directly off the tram stop. Even with bags, it was an easy trip to the hotel. We found the room to be comfortable, although very small for a double. Our suitcases had to be placed on the floor next to the bed and we had to step over them to reach the bathroom. The bathroom was tiled in marble and was immaculate. The shower was small, but worked just fine. And the air conditioner worked great (thankfully, as the temperature was extreme during our visit). The hotel staff were helpful and the breakfast was average. We tried using the computer in the lobby for internet access (at a small cost), but it didn't work. The hotel was within 15 minute walk from the Vatican, the Forum and the Spanish Steps. It was right in the middle of everything, so we were very happy about our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MRPlayter
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a good location in Rome, but the room was SMALL, the front desk never smiled, it was over-priced, but worst of all, our friends were bumped and sent to another hotel that was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: muzikjunky
Reviews.Content: The service was nice, the room was even better. It is located by Campo de Fiori so you can easily find fruits and vegatables and cheeses for lunch. The market stand people were very helpful even if you spoke the tiniest bit of Italian. Our internet didn't work at first (after going back to the room to get cash to pay) so the front dest staff helped for at least 20 minutes to get it going. They arranged a taxi to the airport, that was very much worth it. The breakfast was wonderful. There were plenty of sweets, yogurts, cereals, meats and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in the heart of the Ancient City”
Reviews.Author: architerp
Reviews.Content: Albergo Smeraldo is a nice quaint little hotel in the heart of Rome for a great price. Nice clean room though your basic small euoprean hotel room. The staff was pleasant and the breakfast was a bit above average for these types of hotels. I had a single room which upon checking in, I found had a small semi-private terrace. The main roof terrace is also nice, though I did not spend much time out there. I chose this hotel for its location near the Campo dei Fiori which is one of my favorite neighborhoods. Walking distance to just about everything, Trastevere, the Pantheon, Piazza Novona, and the Forum. And, it is in a less touristy part of town which allows me to pretend I am a local, if only for just a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rome Location, OK room”
Reviews.Author: JrMushroom
Reviews.Content: The location is great, and correspondingly expensive for what you get. The shower was really small, and the bed not too comfortable. This is the only place I've stayed in Rome, so I don't know how it compares. The double-paned french windows are a nice touch; shutting them reduced the noise level of the street quite well. The roof garden isn't much. We had the breakfast once; but with such great coffee and pastry everywhere- what's the point? The staff was helpful when pressed!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel - great value”
Reviews.Author: Bradford_City_Fan
Reviews.Content: Spent a Saturday night here during a recent sightseeing trip to Rome. The hotel is off the main roads, at a corner of two typical cobbled Roman back-streets. It's a great base for exploring the centro storico, the area around Campo dei Fiori and the ghetto. The room was comfortable and clean, with decent aircon and a powerful, hot shower. The (English-speaking) service was friendly and very helpful. Staff were happy to call us a cab and let us leave our luggage for a few hours after we had checked out. As you'd expect at this price, no room-service or mini-bar, but there is a reasonably-priced vending machine in reception selling water, soft drinks and beer (and a nice little local bar opposite). Breakfast included decent fresh coffee, juice and bread / pastries. Nothing special but absolutely fine. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection, the staff was marvelous as were the rooms.”
Reviews.Author: TravelGramma52
Reviews.Content: Though the rooms are small, they are so well planned and decorated that there was nothing missing. The location couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint”
Reviews.Author: Roena
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was on a narrow street right in the heart of Rome. The hotel was clean with a responsive staff. The office staff had a city map on the counter and when we asked for directions they would pull out a pen and circle "you are here" and draw the path for us to walk. The woodwork on the walls was absolutely beautiful. We walked to everything in the heart of the city. We were served a complete breakfast every morning which included very good strong coffee, Italian pastries, cereal and fruit juice. Internet was an extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, great location, worth every penny.”
Reviews.Author: Tjall49
Reviews.Content: In a quiet street, in the old center of Rome. Great for easy walking to all the highlights. Good beds, no street-noise at all. Simple but fine breakfast. Good rooms, enough space, clean, good shower, nice atmosphere. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “I recommend it! Location couldn´t be better!”
Reviews.Author: Ana_bbr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the "Dipendenza Smeraldo" just around the corner from the main hotel and it was really nice! The building was renovated and had new rooms. We had our room cleaned everyday. The room size was nice and the staff was very polite. The location is excellent (campo de fiori), near to the main touristic points(you can go walking or by bus), next to bars and nice restaurants. I don´t know how the main hotel rooms are but I definatelly recomend the Dipendenza Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Jennyxobu
Reviews.Content: I liked the prime location and rates at this hotel so I guess I can't really complain too much. However, the staff was extremely rude and unhelpful. The hotel has an elevator but only lets you use during certain hours (regardless of whether you are carrying luggage or not). They do not offer to help with your luggage when they do not allow you to use the elevator and the rooms were not the cleanest in the world (but were satisfactory). However, on rate and location alone, this place is good. If you are not planning to spend a lot of time in the room, it is the perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable but loud and small. Can't imagine a better location.”
Reviews.Author: RomoRomo
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location, a pizza throw from Campo De Fiore, and very close to necessary buses and trams. Stayed here for 3 nights based on a friend's recommendation. The room was small but ADORABLE. Was a great example of how much nice design can make up for a small space. Room seemed recently renovated, with marble floors and flat-screen TV. It was spotless and everything worked properly. Major problem I had was the noise... not from partying guests or outside, but from the thin door and those marble floors --could hear everything going on in the hall and water running through the pipes. Woke me up a couple times. Also found the 5 euro/hour of wifi access to be maddening --may be a Europe thing, but seemed like a bum deal. Free breakfast was modest but had good coffee and friendly service. Arranged with hotel for airport pickup, which was expensive but convenient. I don't know if a regular taxi driver would find this place, as it's on a small side street. Tiny elevator and no help with luggage. Desk service was not terribly friendly, but got me where I needed to go. It wouldn't be so bad if I had to stay here again, but I'd look for other options in the area to see if anything's better at this price range. And I'll bring earplugs and/or a runner carpet for the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet but the worst bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: MarybethJ
Reviews.Content: The double-pane windows were very appreciated, as the room was extremely quiet. For a room in central Rome, it was also quite large with plenty of room to wheel our luggage around. It was nice to have all that space. However, the springs in the bed could be felt throughout the entire surface of the mattress, so it was like laying on top of some sort of torture device. Just horrible. The hotel is nicely situated, clean, offers a substantial breakfast (and they made me a cappuccino), but when you're traveling, you must be able to sleep well. This hotel must replace these awful beds. There was also a sewer-type smell emerging from the bathroom, but this was solved by leaving the fan on and the bathroom door closed all night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 11travellers
Reviews.Content: We had only one day in Rome before leaving for Umbria and chose this hotel for its location. The location did not disappoint; it was perfect and the price was reasonable. The staff was OK, breakfast was sufficient but the noise in the street kept us awake a good part of the night. I would recommend the hotel but suggest that you request a rear room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: scottie8scotlans
Reviews.Content: Small room but very clean and everything worked, heating included. Desk staff perfectly pleasant and helpful. For the location this hotel represents excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Historic center location”
Reviews.Author: Travelingotter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Oct. 14-19 - great room with windows opening to street - could hear the church bells. Once you closed the windows you could not hear the street noise. Very centrally located - easy walk to Campo De Fiori, Piazza Navonna, Pantheon and Trevi. Staff was great in helping us with questions or calling for Taxis. Taxi's had a hard time finding hotel to take us back - what worked well was having a map showing the location of the hotel - some taxi's had GPS that was a blessing. Great little bakery around the corner, restaurant across the street. We would definitely stay here again. Shower was cramped but the rest of the room was good and clean. Had a small elevator. Breakfast was Ok - nothing spectacular no fruit nor eggs but they did have ham, cheese, pound cake, hard rolls, toast, juice, coffee etc.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: CarmelJuan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at Albergo Smeraldo. As others have noted the location of the hotel couldn't be better for sight seeing in ancient Rome. The positives for this hotel are it's location, cleanliness and price. I would rate this hotel as very good or even excellent if it were not for it's rude front desk staff. Every interaction I had with this staff was unpleasant.
