The prevailing attitude was that they were doing me a favor by letting me stay at their hotel and that any question or request that I had was an annoyance to them. Not even a simple "Grazie" when we checked out. The next time I'm in Rome I'll be staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: CaptainSubtext79
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Hotel Smeraldo. It's a "no frills" hotel, but the rooms were clean, the bed was comfortable, the staff was friendly and helpful, the hotel was safe and quiet, and the location is GREAT. If you are looking for a posh, elegant hotel with lots of amenities then this is not the hotel for you. But if you are looking for a safe, quiet, comfortable hotel in the heart of Rome then look no further! We didn't plan on spending much time awake in our hotel room, so this is all we were looking for. For Rome, we felt the price was competitive for what we were looking for. And the location is hard to beat: 5 minute walk to Campo de' Fiori, 7 to Piazza Navona, 10 to Piazza Venezia, 20 to the Roman Forum, etc. We were impressed with how accessible everything was. We would likely stay at this hotel again the next time we came to Rome (which is hopefully sooner rather than later!). We found it to be a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great value”
Reviews.Author: SusanLarson27
Reviews.Content: The Smeraldo is perfectly located near the Campo di Fiore and in central Rome. We knew the rooms were small and this was not a hindrance as the bathrooms are nicely updated and an elevator is available to reach upper rooms. It was quiet and the front desk staff were most pleasant and knowledgeable. All in all, excellent value and without a doubt, we would book here again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: golfdrive20
Reviews.Content: Great find for a stay in rome, hotel is clean and staff are helpful and friendly, yes the rooms can be a bit small but they are perfectly adequate. The thing that puts this hotel up there is the location, large square 3 minutes walk away has plenty of bars, cafes and restuarants and all the main attractions really are within walking distance or short taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “Nice basic and clean rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: GradSchool_09
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Smeraldo for 4 nights in August of 2009. Had some pretty hot weather, so we were thankful that the hotel had AC (kept us quite comfortable at night). Hotel is pretty basic. Clean room and bathroom. AC and TV. Internet is available, small on site computer station in lobby and wifi are available. Cost is extra to get on the internet- buy card at front desk. Great location, just steps from Campo de' Fiori and Piazza Navona. Also, a great bakery is just across the street from the hotel. So be sure to check that our for breakfast and/or lunch. Hotel is a short walk or bus ride to the sites. The Largo Argentina bus stop is only a few blocks from the hotel. Bus 64 and 40 are great routes. Also, within easy walking distance to the Vatican (10-15 minute walk). Front desk staff was helpful, booked us transport to airport. No problem. Only disappointing thing about hotel was its roof terrace. Not very nice, poor view. All and all and good basic, clean place to stay. Excellent homebase to explore the city (good value).

Reviews.Title: “Excellant location and great stay”
Reviews.Author: keeper616
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect after reading the mixed reviews, but I am so happy I booked this hotel. The room was spotless. The room was cleaned and fresh towels were brought everyday. The staff was efficient and helpful whenever I had any sort of request. The price on venere was superb and I could not have asked for a better location! I will definitely stay here again if I ever visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Walk everywhere from Smeraldo”
Reviews.Author: MONichols
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at the Hotel Smeraldo. As usual, it was just great. We had two twin rooms, just down the hall from each other. They were impeccably clean and the air conditioning was worth the price of the stay. Each day we walked to sights, the "Roman Shuffle" as it's called. We came back in the afternoons for a nap in the air conditioned rooms, then at dusk headed out the door for the great restaurants in Piazza Navona (Don Quixote is our favorite) and Campo di Fiore (we loved the namesake at the Carbonara). Both of these nighttime hot spots were less than a 5 minute walk from this hotel. Ignore the grafitti in the neighborhood and head for the Smeraldo. The front desk people are very nice if you remember this is not a concierge desk as in a 4 star luxury hotel. If they could improve the mattresses, it would be worth the extra $$$$.

Reviews.Title: “Can only recomend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nika2005
Reviews.Content: Can recomend this hotel for your stay in Rome - perfect location for most sights - rooms are not large ( we were 3 in 1 room) but then we knew that in advance and we didt go to Rome to stay in the room. Can recommend the breakfast as well - hear a lot about poor breakfast in Rome - but we found 7 euro a good buy compared to what we alternatively paid at a cafe on Campo di Fiori. Reception always seemed very busy - bur then we only needed then to hand our keys - great value for money at this hotel - would without doubt stay here again. We had a room to a backyard - so there was no noise from the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here! you wont be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Misslollyd
Reviews.Content: I checked out this hotel before booking my latest trip to Rome (have been twice before) and was abit undecided as the reviews were not great and not very recent...however me and my travelling buddie decided to take the plunge! well we decided to stay in the sister hotel which is just across the way but you deal with the smeraldo for reception etc. So glad we choosed this hotel for the following reasons it was clean, rooms were not massive but enough space for everything, towels were changed daily and room was tidied everyday which was fab, extra pillows and loads of coat hangers (which is a must for us girlies) Reception staff did seem abit stand offish at first but that soon improved. Overall I think you cannot beat this hotel for price and its fab location (just round the corner from the buzzing piazza) Would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “You can do better for the price”
Reviews.Author: Jdr1637
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of our Italian trip, so its shortcomings were probably heightened in comparison with our other lodgings. The room was small and had a bad odor. The staff was minimally friendly and even gave out false information like "No, churches aren't closed between 12 and 4." They are. There's a dorm, hostel feel to the place. I expected little considering the low price, but it didn't even reach my already low expectations. The location is wonderful, steps from Campo di Fiori, and the hidden aspect of the hotel -- it's located in an alley -- are definite pluses, but I believe there are better options for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Bare bones”
Reviews.Author: giveittomestratight
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights from May 29th through June 1st. It is situated close to the Campo De Fiori and Largo Argentina. The hotel is clean and the triple room had a good layout. with two beds in one area and one bed in a separate area through a hall, bathroom in the middle. The rooms are small and simple. The beds are hard. There's nothing in terms of decoration. The closets are newly buitl and very adequate, they are armoires with shelves and space to hang clothes and put your suitcase in. Small televisions in each room. The bathroom is fine, I think all bathrooms in Rome are made of marble which makes them superior to the rooms. The decor in the hotel is bare bones. The wi-fi service is only avaialbe for 5 euro per hour from the lobby, not the rooms. The terrace closes at 8:00 so we never got to see it. There is a nice restaurant in front of the hotel, trattoria moderna, which was a nice surprise. It doesn't look like much but the food was delicious. The coffee and desserts were great too. Breakfast at the hotel is okay. The service is not up to par, they really look annoyed of having to serve their patrons. I needed ice for my mother who had a swollen ankle and they said they didn't have an ice machine and to try at the restaurant in front of the hotel. There was a great shop for cheese, wine and prosciutto behind te hotel, I think the name was Rosciolli. I had a completely different experience at the hotel San Carlo near the Spanish Steps, very attentive. Of course I paid a higher price. I would not recommend this hotel to freinds or family.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is perfectly located, comfortable, and very clean.”
Reviews.Author: Linda131
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 7 nights at Hotel Smeraldo. The hotel is located within walking distance of essentially everything in Rome. It is around the corner from the Campo del Fiore with a street lined with shops, "bars" and vendors. The hotel has wi-fi in the lobby and provides a continental breakfast in a comfortable breakfast room. The rooms are small but very clean and the bathrooms (we stayed in two rooms) were immaculate. The windows are so soundproof we never heard any noise from the streets and the AC worked great. The location is really fabulous. We only took one bus, once, to Termini; we walked everywhere else! The staff isn't overly friendly, but they were very accommodating and were fluent in English.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: FrancesPatrick
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 17 day trip to Italy. I used Rick Steves' guidebook to book hotels in Venice, Florence, Siena, Assisi and Rome. I chose the Smeraldo for location and price. We were to stay 6 nights, May 6 thru May 12. I e-mailed them directly on March 12,requesting a room. They answered promptly, with availabilty and price, advising that, "to hold the room, send an e-mail with credit card number, information and authorization to withdraw the cost of the first night". They noted that this deposit is non-refundable, even in case of cancellation. I complied, sent the credit card and info and kept a copy of the sent e-mail. A month later, I wrote to them again, mentioning the dates of our reservation and asking if they could book a day during our stay for a trip to the Borghese museum. The one-sentence reply, "Yes, we can but just when you can be in the hotel." When we arrived on May 6, the clerks had no record of our reservation and asked to see "their confirmation". I produced the 3 e-mails and replies. Then, quite rudely, they said that I should have checked my bank statement for the deposit and that I should have a specific form from them. They did quickly relocate us to a nearby hotel, which had uncomfortable beds, a very basic breakfast and a very unfriendly staff. It did not have a television or an elevator (we were on third floor...they left us to carry our own bags. We requested new towels on our third day there. The maid didn't change them but they did give me some when I went down the 3 flights to get them.

Reviews.Title: “It was like rudeness was their brand.”
Reviews.Author: kRw0507
Reviews.Content: We're don't choose hotels for a luxury, boutique experience and until this trip have selected them mainly based on price, cleanliness and location above all else. So when we read some negative reviews about Hotel Smeraldo, we decided it would be fine. It's in a great location (the Pantheon neighborhood of Rome), a reasonable price considering, and recently has been renovated. But it was truly uncanny how ridiculously dismissive every single member of the staff was, as if they had absolutely no time or patience for us. We split our stay in Rome, and therefore stayed at the hotel in early and mid-May; every encounter with various staff - particularly those at the front desk - was exactly the same. We had to laugh about it. When we had an issue with our room on the second half of the trip (first floor room smelled like sewer gas so we asked to be relocated), several staff members acted put out by our request for a change. Having stayed nowhere else in Rome, I hesitate to say I wouldn't recommend what otherwise is a well-managed, clean hotel with modern bathrooms, etc., but wow, this crew has the market cornered on attitude, and certainly didn't add an ounce of charm or warmth to our stay in the glorious city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Great location, service could be better.”
Reviews.Author: ATLWanderLust
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights as part of a 2 week trip for our anniversary. I have been to Italy several times and I always like to stay near the Campo dei Fiori, but I wanted to try a new hotel since my last one left a lot to be desired. For the most part, I found the Hotel Smeraldo to be just fine. The room was nice, it was in a quiet location near everything, and for the location, I thought it was a very good value. However I think the breakfast the hotel offers at 7 euros, is not a good value. We opted to buy pastries at the bakery across the street from the hotel for 1 euro each and have cafe latte's at the cafe across the street for 1.5 euros each. We would spend usually less than 7 euros total for breakfast rather than the 7 euro per person the hotel charges. If anyone needs any fruit, there is an open air market in the campo dei fiori nearly every morning and the produce was wonderful! One word of warning: The hotel turns the power to your room off when you leave, and when we returned our first night after dinner and a night walk through Rome, the power wouldn't turn back on in our room. The man at the front desk tried to tell us it was our fault that we had plugged something in wrong and shorted the room out. We had not plugged anything in at all, we had literally dropped our luggage off and left for the day. We were eventually moved to another room, but while I was packing up my luggage in the dark (I had hung up some dresses in the closet for the wrinkles to fall out), the man at the front desk rung the room phone and asked us why were not coming down and we were wasting his time. I told him we were packing and would be down shortly and he said he didn't know what we were saying but to come down NOW. We were moved into what I assume is the handicap suite on the main floor. It was slightly larger and had no stairs, and we were fine in that room and the staff was fine from then on. But it was a bit annoying at the end of an evening when you are exhausted to have to change rooms, pack in the dark, and then be blamed for an electrical shortage there is no way you could have caused. But that event aside, I think I might stay here on a return trip, I will just bring a flashlight next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not extraodinary, but location is great.”
Reviews.Author: Dina808
Reviews.Content: This hotel is your basic hotel recommended by Rick Steves. Location was excellent. Rooms were clean, but shower was small. This is pretty much the norm in Europe though and I am pleasantly surprised whenever I do get a bigger shower. Service was so so, depending on who was at the reception desk at the time. Breakfast was decent. If you are not into luxury and you just want a clean room and a shower with hot water, then this hotel is for you. After all that's what we needed and wanted. Rome was waiting for us to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return”
Reviews.Author: mplsJIm
Reviews.Content: Good location, but walls are paper thin, and the water pipes regularly and loudly proclaimed someone above had either flushed the toilet or was taking a shower. Fairly helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Probably would stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: maxmicliz
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is in a great location and probably a good value considering Rome is expensive, I would probably not stay there again. The rooms were clean but the shower situation was a problem. Our first 2 nights we were in a room with a shower so tiny that even a petite person such as myself could barely fit. The water pressure was bad and it never really got hot. As a matter of fact, if you go when they have large school groups staying there you might not ever get a warm shower. The staff as mentioned here time and time again was unfriendly and curt. I'm not a high maintenance person but I do expect hotel staff to be friendly. I guess they figure they don't need my money when they get alot of school groups filling up the rooms. Which is another red flag. If you want quiet and you hit it wrong and have kids staying there you're out of luck.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again, Location was the best part!”
Reviews.Author: mimi1178
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at this hotel. The location couldn’t be beat for the price, near the Campo di Fiori and a ton of great restaurants. We could walk everywhere: Pantheon/Piazza Navona (5 min), Trevi Fountain (10-15 min), St. Peters (20 min), the Coliseum/Forum (20 min), even the Borghese Gallery (40 min). The hotel itself is missing that European charm but is still cute. Our room was small but clean, the beds were too much on the firm side for us but we slept fine since we were exhausted every night. The bathroom was small and the tiny shower was a bit of an adventure every morning. Not sure if the included breakfast was worth it, its just rolls and yogurt and coffee (as has been my experience in other hotels in Europe) but it was definitely quick and convenient. Our feeling was, when you are spending all day out sightseeing all you need is a place to sleep and shower and this was perfect. The very definition of No Frills. The other reviews on this site are spot on about the staff though. I found them to be nice and helpful if we asked questions but not forthcoming with asking us if we needed a map, directions, etc. They made dinner reservations for us every night though after I asked. Fortunately we had done our research and had a map, and we like to explore on our own. One thing they don’t tell you is that at breakfast you can order cappuccino from the waitress. We overheard someone else do it so we did it took and it was much better than the regular coffee they serve! It was little things like that that were lacking but we wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again and would recommend it to others with the few caveats I mentioned above. For us, it was exactly what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, indifferent service”
Reviews.Author: Fraze73
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent 3 nights at this hotel earlier this month. The hotel is clean and the rooms are adequate although the bathrooms are a little on the small side. Where they let themselves down is on the service. It's not that they are especially rude but the staff certainly seem to be indifferent about their guests. On the plus side the breakfast was fine and about what you'd expect for a hotel in this class and the location is excellent for Pantheon, Piazza Navona etc with the Colosseum and Forum a 10 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average rooms and ambiance”
Reviews.Author: jgoto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated close to the Campo di'Fiore, making it a great location for accessing all the sights in Rome. The hotel itself is lacking in ambiance and is a bit out of date. The room size is adequate, but the bathrooms are cramped and hot water is not always available. Liked best: location, value Liked least: old bedding, small bathroom, unreliable hot water

Reviews.Title: “Roman Favorite”
Reviews.Author: KieranR
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 5 day stay at Hotel Smeraldo. It's location is great. The breakfasts were good. Airport pickup went well. Room was tiny, roof terrace was a disappointment. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: megt4
Reviews.Content: Hotel Smeraldo has an excellent location, very convenient to many landmarks. It is also very reasonably priced for being in the heart of Rome. The rooms were fine; they were fairly comfortable, though the showers were not the best. However, I was very disappointed with the staff, they were not welcoming or friendly at all, and even very simple requests, such as an extra pillow, were greeted with irritation and exasperation. My husband and I were disappointed to be treated like this during our honeymoon, especially since we received such excellent service at all the other places we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: QueenBeee
Reviews.Content: We arrived in early November and stayed one night before leaving Rome and then 3 nights on our return to Rome. We were 2 couples traveling together. Our rooms were in the annex. The first rooms we stayed the first night in were on a courtyard and nice and quiet. The second rooms for the last nights were on the street and noisier. We could hear our neighbors in the hotel. Both rooms and bathrooms were very small but very clean and well appointed. Pillows were a bit too firm, beds comfortable, bedding old but clean. We are use to staying in fine hotels but on this trip we were looking for inexpensive and clean. For 100euro a night this was a very good value. Not spacious luxury but clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. Front desk personal were professional. We booked directly with the hotel by phone when on-line methods indicted no availability. Rate was less than booking on-line.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Staff was.....”
Reviews.Author: GirlTraveler70
Reviews.Content: As the other reviewers have said, the hotel is in a great location. The staff on the other hand is not terribly helpful. The person who checked us in was really nice. It went downhill from there. We received short answers when we asked questions, such as directions. We didn't request anything complicated or difficult, they just were not pleasant. However, we were expecting issues so we were not surprised. The room itself was basic and had two English channels. The bathroom while decent sized, had the smallest shower I have ever used. For those who have cruised before, it was actually smaller than a ship's shower if you can believe it. The door came together on a corner of the shower so that you had to scoot in sideways. Don't have any extra girth cause you won't make it. I dropped the soap and had to open the doors to bend over to retrieve it. I'll post pictures. Please excuse the mess we created. There was a ton of closet space. We had so much we didn't use it all. The window opened to a small courtyard below. Unfortunately the smoke from smokers downstairs came into our room. The hotel is very loud! Every voice and door could be heard in the room. We could hear everything from the people next door on our last night. The elevator is up a flight of stairs. It was super small and will hold either two people or one person with one suitcase. We ended up sending one person downstairs while the other stayed up and sent the elevator down with just suitcases. We found a grocery store about a block away that had six packs of water for 2 Euro rather than 2 Euros each at all of the tourist places. They also sell wine. The front desk had a bottle opener. The salad place near the hotel (on the main street) was good. For 80 euro cents you can get espresso at the place on the corner just outside of the front door. I wish we had known that before the last night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Choice for Value Hotel in Cenral Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tobster2
Reviews.Content: We started off our Italian vacation in Rome and stayed 2 nights at the Smeraldo Hotel in mid June 2008. As I was planning for our trip a few months prior, I quickly became very discouraged as I was researching hotels in Rome. Unless we were prepared to pay a fortune, I was not able to find a reasonably priced hotel in central Rome that was clean. Everything was super expensive and some of the lesser expensive ones (125 - 200 Euros) had very mixed and poor reviews ... small rooms and not very clean. Then I came across the Smeraldo hotel which gave me much hope. We were very pleased with our choice. This relatively small hotel basically had everything we were looking for at a reasonably affordable price (by Roman standards). It is exceptionally well located near Campo di Fiori. We walked to many of the tourist sites from the hotel. It is located in a small and relatively quiet street, a few blocks away from a main street. At night, we walked to and from the many quaint Piazzas that were found within close proximity. Right across the hotel, there is a cafe and a restaurant and right around the corner, there is a wonderful bakery that serves fresh take out pizzas, paninis and other baked goodies at excellent prices. Lots of wonderful restaurants, cafes and shops can be found within walking distance. If you enjoy eating, you must try the Ristorante del Pallaro, a wonderful restaurant serving Roman food that is 2 blocks away from the hotel. For a very reasonable set price, there is a fixed 8 course menu, including wine, served in an outdoor terrace. Service was wonderful and the food was absolutely delicious. The room as well as the bathroom at the Smeraldo were very small, one of the smallest ones I have ever stayed in, but this seems to be the standard in Rome. If you know this as the outset, you will not be disappointed. After all, how much time will you spend in your room? It had all the basic amenities and was very clean which was extremely important to us especially in view of the reviews we read of other hotels located in central Rome. The view from our window was almost non-existent. For a wonderful view, however, the hotel has a rooftop terrace. The rooftop terrace was an excellent place to relax, to enjoy the views of Roman rooftops, and to eat something you bought outside the hotel and drink a wine you purchased. Although there are some reviewers of this hotel who found the service at the front desk to be poor, the gentlemen who were there during our stay were very professional, courteous and helpful. Breakfast at the hotel was simple ... breads, salami and cheese. The juice, however, tasted like powdered juice. Upon our arrival to Rome, one of the first things we did was take a tour bus around Rome. There are many such companies that provide the hop on and off tour bus option, allowing you to visit the various sites during a 12 or 24 hour period. There are some better ones, the double decker red bus being one of the better ones and I believe the original one. This is a good way to see the various sites and decide on which ones you want to visit in more detail. We loved Rome. It was my first time and I was very pleasantly surprised. It is one of my favourite major cities in the world. There is so much to do and visit in Rome ... 2 days are not enough. I found the prices generally reasonable, better than what I was anticipating. There are good bargains to be had in terms of shopping and dining. The pizzas sold by weight at the various pizzarias located thoughout Rome were truly delicious. For those who enjoy outdoor dining, there are many choices that will satisfy your tastes. Given the hotel's central location, its reasonable price, its clean rooms, the Smeraldo, a basic 3 star hotel, is an excellent value choice and we would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: CaWino
Reviews.Content: The Smeralo is great value. We paid 155 euro for a double room. The room was nicely appointed with cable TV, and air conditioning. A breakfast including coffee, juice, rolls, cheese, and salami was included in the price. They have a computer set-up with Internet connection for five euro per hour. It was located in a private room near the lobby. Another nice touch was the rooftop garden. It had a table and chairs with some nice views. We enjoyed several glasses of Chianti while relaxing and soaking up the atmosphere. Location: the hotel is a stones throw to Campo Fiori - less than five minute walk. Piazza Navonna was almost as close, too. There was a bakery just around the corner and several good restaurants nearby. Rome is one city where you want to stay in the center and this is about as good as it gets. The wait staff was very friendly. The front desk less so, but I wouldn't call them rude as other reviewers have. I was very satified with our four day stay and would certainly consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful with customers !!! Cold hearted !!”
Reviews.Author: attachphotos
Reviews.Content: They DO NOT CARE FOR CUSTOMERS !! My husband and I were counting the days to our trip to tour Italy.....Unfortunately 3 days before departure I fell ill and had to be admitted to the hospital where I stayed for 2 weeks recovering from emergency surgery. My husband immediately contact all our hotels and airline companies and follow procedures of cancellation, and sent letters from the hospital to all of them. ALL waived cancellation fees since we followed procedures and provided appropriate documentation of our unfortunate and unexpected event. However HOTEL SMERALDO, DIDN'T !!!!!!!! Even though we gave them 3 days notice, called them on the phone, and sent them a letter from the hospital ....THEY DID NOT CARE !!! We were FULLY CHARGED for our room. AWFUL !!! While other hotels wished me a speedy recovery and were looking foward to accomodating us on our future trip to Italy HOTEL SMERALDO JUST SENT US THE BILL !! I am not surprised to read on other postings the the staff is rude.....be aware of shaddy hotels like this. WOULD NEVER do business with Hotel Smeraldo again !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: wanderLust18
Reviews.Content: We were happy with our stay at Smeraldo...the location is great - just a few blocks from Campo di Fiori. You can walk from the hotel to most tourist attractions (if you're up for a longish walk that is). The room was small, but clean. Had a comfy bed, air condtioning and a tiny but clean attached private bath.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: crlep
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a few days in the end of June and could not have asked for a better location! It was right next to Campo de Fiori and within walking distance to most of the major sites (with good walking shoes!!). The rooms were small but overall it was a great value. The rooftop terrace was really cute,especially to enjoy a glass of wine before going out to dinner! The staff was not friendly, however we still enjoyed our stay since we knew to expect that.

Reviews.Title: “quaint neighborhood in rome”
Reviews.Author: areedCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The smeraldo hotel is cute and expensive. We had a triple room and it was very small. The bathroom was very nice and had all that you needed. The neighborhood is old school with cobblestones, shops, and restaurants. You do have to walk a while to get anywhere. I would recommend taking the metro everywhere in Rome. Do not take taxis unless the subway is closed, you will save a lot of money. The staff was not the friendliest but not mean. If you have a question they will answer it but that is it. They have breakfast every morning which was ok. All in all I thought the location was great, quiet, and Rome is amazing you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy and Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: Jdani17
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have asked for a better location. We were right by Campo di Fiori, great eating, shopping, entertainment. Our hotel room was a triple with three twin beds, very small beds, not overly plush but not horrible. Very small bathroom, small shower. The place is kept very clean though. The front desk staff wasn't very friendly or helpful but you don't have to deal with them too much. We stayed 4 days. It was the perfect amount of time.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget choice”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkGirlNewYork
Reviews.Content: We thought this hotel was a good deal for the money (140 euros a night). We walked everywhere - colliseum, Pantheon, Travestere... There are nice cafes and bakeries in the neighborhood. At first it seemed a little noisy because you're right above the alleyway but when we closed the shutters and turned on the a/c, we could hardly hear anything. The staff wasn't particularly friendly but they answered all our questions and did call us a flat-rate taxi to the airport. Our only complaint here - the shower. I had no idea they could make them that small. Every time we used it the floor was covered with water. A really large person would truly not fit.

Reviews.Title: “Hated It So Much, Had To Leave”
Reviews.Author: YankeeInBerko
Reviews.Content: Booked through Romeby.com What an awful hotel. Wouldn't let the photos fool you... The hotel is down an ally. The rooms are barely big enough for the uncomfortable bed in it, let alone for two adults and their luggage. The showers are great if you are under five feet tall and weigh less than 90 lbs. The gentlemen at the front desk were incredibly unfriendly and unhelpful. We had a car and they wouldn't even tell us where to park. We described where we had parked and they said it was fine, only turns out it was completely illegal. We had to find that out and find the local public garage on our own. Even though we booked 2 months in advance, they stuck my husband and me in the room behind reception where we could hear every single thing that happened in the lobby. There was one tiny window with bars across it. Despite the air conditioning, it was damp. We asked to change rooms and they lied to me, saying there weren't any others available. Then they showed my husband a room on the fourth floor with a single bed. We canceled our stay and went to Hotel Raphael, about 4 blocks away. It was twice the price but a true luxury experience. What a fantastic hotel! Now Smeraldo is trying to charge us £145 euro cancellation fee, which we are refusing to pay due to what we believe is false advertising. My parents and uncle stayed here and while their stay was tolerable, it wasn't great. The breakfast wasn't worth eating. To get to that roof deck (which has just one average size picnic table and a view of surrounding roof-top TV antennas), you have to walk through (literally) the hotel's drying laundry. There MUST be better hotels than Smeraldo in the same price range (recommend checking guide books such as Lonely Planet). If you have a little more to spend, then I highly recommend Hotel Raphael. It was beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: LeslieRMH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Smeraldo for 4 nights in late June. We were extremely pleased with the hotel. Yes, the rooms are small, but they’re just fine and nicely appointed. We had a double (with a nice large bed), and the triple for our kids consisted of two separate areas, one with two beds and the other with one bed, making for a nice private area for one of the kids. This was an unexpected benefit. We had two of only three rooms on an isolated section of the first (one above ground level) floor. Since we saw the guests in the third room only once, it felt like we had the area to ourselves. (If you’re interested in this arrangement, ask for Rooms 112 and 114.) The location is absolutely phenomenal. The area is so charming and has so much to offer: central location, markets, shops, etc. It is extremely close to Campo dei Fiori; a quick walk down a street lined with shops and bars. We never ate breakfast at the hotel; if you do, you are charged 7 Euros per person. Not only was that a lot to pay (a pastry can be had from across the alley for ~ 2 Euros), but our family was out so late at night that we never would have made the breakfast (closes at 10:00 AM). All the other sites were within approximately a 30 minute walk from the hotel: Vatican City, Spanish Steps, Colosseum, Trevi Fountain was closer, and even closer yet are Piazza Navona and the Pantheon. The staff was nothing but cordial, friendly and helpful. The air conditioning was perfect. When we checked in, one of the rooms was a bit warm. They sent someone to the room IMMEDIATELY and it was fixed (just needed to be adjusted). When we returned after hours of exploring the city, the air conditioning was still running. The rooftop garden is nice; it has a canopy as protection from the sun. Unfortunately, it closes at 8:00 PM, so we weren’t able to go up after we returned from dinner. But, we got sandwiches one day from a bar across the alley and bread, cheese, salami, olives, and we ate them on the rooftop garden. I would stay at Hotel Smeraldo again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “It was great - not sure what the complaints are about”
Reviews.Author: BoulderBaehres
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Fantastic location to everything in the heart of Rome. About 1.5 blocks from Largo Argentina where all the busses stop, so very easy to get around. We arrived at noon and were able to check in right away. The air conditioning could be adjusted as cold as we liked, so it was arctic compared to the rest of Rome. Clean, decent size bathroom, good shutters and double glazing. There's a lift/elevator, which is unusual in Europe. I wonder, if the people who have negative comments are asking too much of a 3-star hotel in Europe? We had no problems with service. We didn't pay for breakfast, but there were many cafes nearby for espresso and pastries. My only complaint was that the roof deck closed at 8:00 pm, and we never got back to the hotel that early.

Reviews.Title: “Sound Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamPaddy
Reviews.Content: Yes as the previous reviews location,location, location. Staff were very friendly and even gave out maps to where you need to go for the day etc. You will not need to get a taxi anywhere if you have a strong pair of shoes. We got the shuttle bus from the Termini back to the airport for 8euro and a taxi to the Termini which cost 11 euro. PLEASE BE AWARE that all TAXI 'S charge a TOURIST rate of 5 euro when you order or hail a taxi. Would stay at the Smeraldo again although I paid 145 euro a night. Venere.com charge 90 euro!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Staff A Little to Be Desired”
Reviews.Author: Finchslanding
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I just returned from a week's tour of Rome and our tour group stayed at the Smelrado. You can't beat the location - a few minute's walk from the Campo di Fiori, 8-10 minutes from the Pantheon, 15-20 minutes walk to the Forum and Colisseum. The room was small and the twin beds hard, but we didn't go to Rome to stay in the room. We walked so much that going to sleep was no problem. One thing I did not realize until the last day is that when you turn in your room key at the desk, they switch off the power to your room - so it does no good to try and leave the air on and cool your room. So if one of your party goes down to the continental breakfast served on the bottom floor, turns in the key, and one stays in the room to finish getting ready, the power is cut! "You must tell me if one stays in the room," the desk guy told me after I reported our power going out. I would agree that the staff is indifferent, not overly friendly and not particulary rude. They speak English fluently. The breakfast was included in our tour, so I don't know if that is a good bargain compared to the bakery next door. I do know that on our last morning, we got overcharged for the pastries we ordered, but just let it go since we were on our way to the airport. A great place to eat near there is La Tartaruga (tortoise) Cantina at 53 Via del Monte della Farina, about 2 blocks from Smeraldo. Excellant pasta and baked grouper. In any event, the price seems good and if you want to be able to walk to see the sights, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not great”
Reviews.Author: bosscutter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 9 nights and unfortunately had a room facing the street. All night we heard motorcyles, cars, yelling and garbage trucks. If you close the windows it becomes very stuffy and hot, as the main desk is not into turning on your air conditioner even though you paid for it!! The room is small and bathroom clean and tiny, but hey, its Italy, it's a place to sleep and change. Breakfast is not much but will do in a pinch. The staff is definately not overly friendly, but not rude, just indifferent. The location is good, near the Campo and main thoroughfares. Overall, I think it is overpriced for the service you receive and would try another hotel in the area for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the staff”
Reviews.Author: max_lk
Reviews.Content: I read the previous reviews on this hotel & booked this primarily on its location. The good points about this hotel are that it's within walking distance from all main attractions, rooms are very clean, the roof garden is a nice escape after a long day walking, not at all noisy at night & the price is okay. Bad points are that the hotel staff are about the rudest & most unhelpful I've ever met. The rooms were very small & showers were tiny. If you are above 'tiny' size then you will most probably accidentally adjust the shower temperature when attempting to move in the shower! If you have no real need for service or advice & know you will be out site seeing all the time, then you may choose this purely for its location. Although I am sure there is better around. Enjoy Rome & the ice cream is fab!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: clemsongal
Reviews.Content: Great location, good price. Very small room, but we didn't mind because we spent our entire time walking around Rome. The front desk staff leaves something to be desired--not overly friendly or helpful and not good about returning emails. We booked this hotel primarily for the location--in Campo de Fiori, within walking distance of all the major sites. The location did not disappoint. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Anna1968
Reviews.Content: I have read the other reviews after I went to this hotel. Believe it or not I wish I had done it before. OK the worst things; the reception employees do speak English but mostly Italian (by the way, we are Dutch). The rooms are very noisy, on the inside because when you close your streetside-window, you can't hear a thing from the street, but more from your neighbours. The breakfast is TERRIBLE. I always said "what can you do to spoil a breakfast" well after being here, everything. The orange juice is a mixture of powder and water, the coffee is heated Tiber-water, the bread is at least 2 days old. So skip the breakfast in this hotel. The beds are ok, but very very short. Long Dutch guys won't fit in it. Same as the bathroom specially the shower, there is a door around this shower corner but it closes very difficult, when it is closed you can't open it anymore.. besides that the temperature of the water changes every moment from very hot to extreme cold. And you are standing with your feet in 10cm water, having a foot bath. It is very clear that the hotel is often used by kids/teenagers being away from their parents... unfortunately there was a group when we were there. They tried to call their friends during the night, dialed the wrong number and woke us.. The hotel has 2 elevators, the one on the front is reachable by a 5-step stair and can contain 2 persons or 1 person and a suitcase. It does not reach the roof terrace because to come there you have to climb 2 stairs. Then you have a nice view on all other roofs. Finally the hotel is not cheap, the rooms are just poor and therefore the hotel is more expensive then a good 2 star hotel. it is classified for a 3 star, I would say it is a poor 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, and a perfect location. Staff was not very helpful...”
Reviews.Author: midwester_2008
Reviews.Content: We were across the street at the Dependence section of this hotel property. Very clean and modern rooms, convenient closets and storage. Overall, very nice. The staff were a bit stand-offish. We were trying to speak Italian, and our efforts were not appreciated. We were treated not like guests, but like pests. That being said, this is an affordable, clean, perfectly-located hotel that I would recommend for a great home base to explore Rome! Walk across the street for coffee/pastries in the morning, then down to Campo de Fiori for a piece of fruit, then head out to explore the city. There is a rooftop patio that is great for splitting a bottle of wine after a long day of walking around ancient Rome!

Reviews.Title: “great location, but service DEFINITELY without a smile.”
Reviews.Author: hodgki76
Reviews.Content: This is a tough review. The hotel has an amazing location, a stone's throw away from the Campo Fiori and really close to Piazza Navona. The room was a decent size for Europe, with a gloriously large (for Europe) bathroom and the windows were soundproofed. Breakfast was ok. The bad. The staff, most of the front desk crew were quite standoffish - and there were several of them. At One point after arriving early in the am after clubbing, we had to argue with the front desk that we were staying at the hotel. He said no, and said you are staying somewhere else. Was he serious?? This was one incident... There was also one gentleman on the evening shift who was quite pleasant. So go figure. If you plan to sleep in, forget it, as cleaners were slamming doors and vaccuming from as early as 730 am (the doors were not sound proof). So its up to, great location, but service DEFINITELY without a smile.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem in the Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: GotABigDog
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located just a few steps from the Campo di Fiori, offering eating and shopping options throughout the day. There is a great bakery and a couple of cafes that are literally across the street. We walked to the Spanish steps, the Colosseum and the Vatican from here. Our room was comfortable, very clean, and we enjoyed the double-paned, full-size window balcony. Additionally, it was very nice to sit on the roof deck and enjoy a glass of wine in the evenings. The staff were not overly friendly, but they never refused a request or didn't answer a question. The breakfast is average, but a welcome amenity while on vacation. This is a reasonably-priced property for the location. You're not going to find better. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel for someone looking for a convenient hotel in the heart of Rome that allows you to get a flavor of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and reasonable for Rome”
Reviews.Author: kfullerwa
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the accomodation is clean and a good price for the heart of Rome. The staff at the front desk is pretty indifferent and sometimes downright rude. The staff at the very adequate breakfast (you are charged extra for this) is very accomodating. If you know in advance that you will probably encounter surly front desk people and you are willing to put up with that for a clean, reasonable, safe hotel, then go ahead and book. That's what I did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location --Poor Attitude”
Reviews.Author: joyceh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the midst of everything. Within close walking distance to Campo Fiore. The room was small but clean and the bed comfortable. Unfortunately, they have such a poor attitude towards Americans that it's hard to get past it. They rent to college kids who are out partying all night and are loud and obnoxious when they are in the hotel. The desk clerk told my husband how disgusted he was at "rich Americans who send their kids to Italy to be babysat by them." He called the girls "whores". There was a group of high school kids also booked there while we stayed and they were well behaved but just the large group that they were in made it quite noisy. I had to dial direct from the hotel as the Credit Card access number that was noted on the room phone wouldn't work and the desk clerk practically yelled at me to just use the 001. This amounted to a 23E phone charge for me because he didn't want to help. We would not stay here again because we prefer quite and peaceful surroundings when we travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Price”
Reviews.Author: SkiGirl06
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for the price and the location is very close to many area attractions. Great for getting around and centrally located. The room was bare but comfortable and clean. I have recommended to others who have since stayed there and they also loved it for the price and location!

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location, if you don't mind the unwelcoming attitude”
Reviews.Author: Itaiphile
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot going for it, especially the convenient central location, half way between Campo dei Fiori and Largo Argentina (where several buses stop, like the 40 that goes to Termini railroad station). It looks cleaner and more stylish than what you'd expect from a small budget hotel. It is unfortunate though that many of the staff members don't have a more pleasant attitude. When I checked in, the man behind the desk barely gave me a glance and was cold and curt almost to the point of rudeness (e io parlo italiano bene). Also the neighborhood seems to have gone downhill since I was last there in 2004 -- graffiti and garbage everywhere, even amidst nice shops and restaurants. If you're looking for a decent budget option, and don't care whether the rooms and bathrooms are small, but want to be centrally located, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LuckySouth
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, one stays here because of the location. At nite it is a stones throw to the popular Campo Fiori square, the Navona Piazza, or the Pantheon area. One can walk anywhere, cobblestone streets, it really is the place to stay. Don't even think about staying on the outskirts or near the colosium. No public transportation is needed. We did take Rome Shuttle from the airport, 35 euros, and someone was waiting with a sign after our long flight. How nice! Smeraldo wanted more than 50 Euros. The room and bath were tiny, decent, no extras. I am of average height and build, maybe smaller, and I could not move in the shower. The staff don't care if you are alive, and it does make a difference. The two hotels we stayed at after this, the staff was FABULOUS. Hotel Dali in Florence, and Ca' Dei' Dogi in Venice. When you have excellent hosts, you see more, experience more, they lead you to fab bakerys, restaraunts, and so forth. I paid 100 euros a nite at Smeraldo in late November. If there was a breakfast they failed to communicate that to me. Most of our nites were quiet, but sometimes we could hear the people using dryers (woke us up), using the bathroom, and one night before we left they rented the room next to us to a group of young men, kids really, and we could hear them screaming, cussing and being obnoxious all night. The staff had to hear them also, but the staff does not care, is not helpful, and have attitude problems. They are not accomadating at all. One nite we asked for a restaurant recommendation and he pulled out a card. We went to the restaurant and it was empty, and all the others around it were busy. We did not eat there. I want to feel good about where I stay, and they just don't and won't care. Again, it does and will make a difference. (sorry about my spelling)!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: DCAbby
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I recently stayed at the Hotel Smeraldo. We could not have asked for a better situation. The room is tiny, but this shouldn't deter you. If you are staying in your hotel room for more than to shower and sleep, you shouldn't be in Rome! It is charmingly European and is on a very cute little street. I'm beginning with the location because I cannot stress to you how close it is to everything. Rome is an incredibly easily-walked city. It would be ridiculous to take any type of public transportation once you are at this hotel. Our first day we were amazed at how close everything is. You can walk to the Forum, Colosseum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, the Vatican, etc. No need to cab it. Back to the hotel--I know that I have seen a review that says that they had trouble with being charged for breakfast, we did not. There were no issues whatsoever. Also, some have said that the service wasn't that great. Honestly, they may not be over the top friendly but they answer your questions and provide you service. There's no rudeness at all. We had a problem with our key late one night and they were so helpful and genuinely felt bad for our trouble (which it wasn't any trouble). The hotel has such a cute roof deck. Go upstairs one night and enjoy a glass of wine before you go out for dinner. Every inch of Rome is absolutely breathtaking and the hotel is just a place to sleep. It's safe and close to everything...everything you need in a hotel. If I can offer another word of advice...from the airport, take the train to Termini. It's the Leonardo Express. It couldn't be easier and takes maybe 20 minutes. We were somewhat mixed as to whether or not to try it and it was so incredibly easy, it would have been silly not to. It's 11 Euro and then a 6-7 Euro cab ride from Termini to just about any location in the city. you're going to spend half the money and you'll probably cut the time in half from taking a cab from the airport. Anyway, I'm so excited for your Roman vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SweetPeaSanDiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Smeraldo for 5 nights and I have to say, you can't beat the location. It is perfectly situated near Campo di Fiori and the Pantheon. The Vatican was a short walk in one direction and the Colosseum a short walk in the other direction. Saying the staff was anywhere near friendly is pushing it. I found them to be cold and uninterested in us the whole time we were there. However, the room was clean and a minimal breakfast was included in the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drums45
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through WorldBy.com We stayed here 3 nights. The location is good, on a quiet little street a few blocks from Campo di fiori. There is a coffee shop and a great restaurant (Trattoria Moderna) across the street. The breakfast was average. We had a triple and a double room. The triple was small but okay. The rooms had good beds and bathrooms. There were no safe or fridge in the rooms. The staff was professional and spoke some english. This is a good hotel for the money. The room furnishings were good quality compared to other hotels in Rome I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Not Great Service”
Reviews.Author: JamesBChicago
Reviews.Content: Staying at Smeraldo Hotel, in Rome, was very nice. The best part of the hotel is it's convenient location (not far from Campo dei Fiori and Piazza Navona). The room was very nice and the bathroom extremely clean. Additionally, they had a very nice breakfast to start your day and if you are at the hotel toward the end of the day, definitely use the roof garden. We met some wonderful couples while enjoying some wine. Our biggest issue was the indifference exhibited by the front desk staff. When ever you asked a question, they made you feel as though they had better things to do. While I had read other reviews warning us, I was still surprised. Also, the bar they advertise was never open (we stayed four nights).

Reviews.Title: “very good value”
Reviews.Author: apb0229
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on holiday with my 9-y-o son, and really liked it. Yes, obviously location is perfect, but it was also clean, shower nice and warm, beds fine, space fine, and breakfast ok too. The alleged unfriendliness of staff eluded me: they seemed ok, and delightfully when we returned to our room at he end of the day my son's cuddly toy had been placed on his pillow.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: clf2118
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in THE BEST location, close to everything. The place was clean and, while the room wasn't huge, it was nice and certainly sufficient for sleeping in between touring. The bathrooms were beautiful and clean. Great value! The front desk people were very helpful, and the breakfast, although not fabulous was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Smeraldo - just OK”
Reviews.Author: gmjennison
Reviews.Content: Location was great but that's about all. Our room was so small we couldn't fit our suitcases anywhere and the bathroom you had to nearly sit sideways on the toilet!!! It was dark and very noisy on the Saturday night. The front desk staff couldn't be bothered and when we kept smiling and being nice to them regardless they still wouldn't go out of their way to help with anything. The air conditioning could only be controlled by them so rather than freezing we had to get them to switch it off all the time. They had no idea about any of the buses to anything - they only offered an expensive (50Euro) car to the airport. For the money, not great.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: ellonsteve
Reviews.Content: Searched the internet and travel guides for a recommended reasonably-priced hotel in central Rome and went for this one. We stayed for 5 nights and it was an excellent choice - fantastic location, exceptionally clean, friendly staff, great breakfasts. It also has a small roof garden which is ideal for a seat in the sun between walks - and just about everything you might want to see in Rome is within walking distance of this hotel!. We had absolutely no complaints and would (in fact will) return without hesitation. Stephen, Aberdeen, Scotland.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Ideal”
Reviews.Author: LaDolceFarNiente
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Smeraldo for 3 nights in Sept./Oct. '07. The location was ideal as it was around the corner from Campo De Fiori and very close to P. Navona, the Pantheon, as well as many shops, bakeries, etc. The room was completely adequate...in fact, we thought our bathroom was quite large for European standards and it was obviously recently re-done. Water pressure was excellent and being two larger people we had no problems "fitting" in the shower (others had complained this would be a problem--not for us!). Yes...the room itself was tiny....but who cares? We compared it to a room in NYC....and we were rarely in there anyway. The hotel/room was clean as well. The beds could have been a bit more comfortable but after walking the streets in Rome all day one tends to just pass out regardless of the comfort of the beds...lol. When we first arrived I thought to myself, "Uh Oh....the staff really are miserable SOB's as some people had commented".....but after awhile they "warmed up" a bit and were more than helpful in arranging for our pick up to the airport the day of our departure. In fact, I recommend this service very much as the Taxi drivers can be somewhat inconsistent with their "fairness" in Rome. The driver arrived on time and it was a nice, comfortable car/ride. As for the breakfast....we didn't eat it....only because we enjoyed going across the street to the little cafe for our morning cappuccino and pastry. We unfortunately did not specify "no breakfast" upon booking so when I asked if we could delete breakfast from our room rate for the second two nights they said "no".....oh well...no biggie. But if you're considering booking this hotel....then definitely specify "no breakfast" upon reserving....the breakfasts across the street are much less expensive and the cafe doesn't charge for sitting! So....with that said....I would definitely return to the Hotel Smeraldo in the future and would recommend it to others. It's no frills.....but it's clean and the location is superb! Viva Roma!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: BlueCrow
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, clean, and well appointed for comfort and rest. Although the rooms were smaller, they were adequate and accommodating. The breakfast offered was just right. The staff courteous. There's a nice little restaurant ten steps from the front door. True, it's no Best Western or Holiday Inn, but that just means it didn't suck like most moderately priced American hotels do. After 30 plus years travelling in Europe, we don't think you can go wrong with this little gem in the heart of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: NettyFletty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for those who want a nice price and a decent hotel. It`s nice, clean, perfect location, you can walk to anything! ( with good shoes of course...) and the staff was ok. Even the breakfast was good! We had a very pleasent stay here. The only thing I did`t like so much, was the booking. I had to send my credit-card info by mail, something you normally avoid... (You can of course send it by fax, but I didn`t access to that. )

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: tidemom
Reviews.Content: The Smeraldo is in a very good location surrounded by great restuarants, shopping, and sights. We arrived on a huge tour bus and the hotel is located on a very narrow street. The bus had to let us out a couple of blocks away with our luggage. That was the only real downside. I was in a single room which was small, but very comfortable and clean with very nice tile floors. I had a balcony with table and chairs which was a real plus and a patio/terrace just steps away from my room. The hotel staff was very helpful but they were very busy most of the time and not very friendly. I had to lay on my southern charm to get a smile. I have to say that they did help me get out of a difficult situation the day I checked out. Went to get Euros from the ATM to pay for my taxi to the airport. The ATM ate my card, leaving me with no way to pay taxi. The hotel agreed to add 50 Euro to my hotel bill and gave me back the cash for the taxi. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a booking mishap”
Reviews.Author: DavidandTaniaH
Reviews.Content: This B&B/hotel is a good bang for your buck especially during high season. It is centrally located, around the corner from campo de fiori with piazza navona close by. The rooms were clean but with very small bathrooms. The mishap that took place was that we had changed the dates of our reservations with them only to find out at our check-in that they hadn't applied the changes to the their "books." We ended up getting charmed by one of the staff members (owner?) and we shared a twin bed for a night and then got a bigger room with a double bed the following night. Overall, a good & affordable place to to stay while on foot most of the day seeing the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: novice_anna
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic and the price is reasonable. This hotel was clean and the air conditioning worked well. Like other reviewers have noted, the staff was crabby and this is a place to sleep- little more. We had room 206- which is about the size of cruise ship cabin. While the room met our needs we did notice the walls of the rooms were very thin. We could hear every conversation, action, etc in the room next door. Overall, a reasonably priced hotel in a great locaton

Reviews.Title: “My favorite area of Rome to stay in!”
Reviews.Author: Puyallup1
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located in the Campo di Fiori neighborhood, close to Piazza Navona, Trevi Fountain, and the Pantheon. There is a daily market in the sqare, a variety of good restaurants, fast food, laundry, internet, bakery, deli, and other interesting shops nearby. The location is very convenient for taking the tram or bus to other parts of the city. The hotel entrance and lobby are small. The staff is helpful and able to answer questions reasonably well in English. I very much appreciated that they allowed us to check in early. The breakfast is a little better than average for Italy in the variety and amount of food available. The hotel was renovated recently and the rooms are small but nice, clean, quiet, reasonably priced, and comfortable. I will definitely stay there again when I go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good, But....”
Reviews.Author: PeteskiWausau
Reviews.Content: Booked it directly after seeing it on kayak.com. The location was great, and that was the main plus. The room was small, even by Rome standards, but the real problem was the bathroom: the shower curtain didn't quite cover the basin - and it was outside of it! Every shower lead to a small lake, even if you were careful with the flow's direction. And the desk staff? They seemed so friendly on the phone and via email, but in person? Slightly to the churlish side of indifferent, although they did answer questions. The breakfast was excellent and that staff was good. There's a nice bar across the street. I'd actually go back here if I could have a slightly larger room with a better designed shower arrangement.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: mangiamo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the final night of a two week trip to Italy, having prepaid by CC. The people at the front desk were pre-occupied most of the time, could hardly get anyone to notice us. Room was small but that was expected, shower very tiny, and you had to watch your head as you entered the Bathroom, as there was a fixture that your head could hit. The day was very warm and we tried to use the AC, no luck. I went down to the front desk and received incorrect info on how to get it going. Went down again and eventually a worker came and got it going. Arriving back in the room later, the AC was OFF and no way was it able to be turned on. Breakfast was in a basement level rather cheerless room. Desk did come through when we asked for a cab to take us to the Airport, it came on time. We were happy to leave this hotel. First time I ever felt that way in Italy after many trips.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Smeraldo Dependence”
Reviews.Author: marytexas10
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews on the site, I booked the Smeraldo Dependence (formerly Parione) hotel rather reluctantly. But boy, am I glad I did! We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The room was very small, but spotlessly clean, with CNN on the TV and an ice cold A/C (and I know what I'm talking about, I'm from Texas!). We were on the 4th floor and the only noise we ever heard was the sound of church bells nearby. Our window also opened up onto a charming courtyard. The cleaning staff was fastidious and very pleasant. We checked in around 12:00 noon and our room was ready and waiting. The rate was 120 Euros per night, per Rick Steves book. (We were required to pay for the entire stay upon check-in, which I did, and we had no problems, it actually made check-out a breeze.) The man at the front desk was very nice and showed us across the street to the Dependence. As two ladies traveling alone, my primary concern was safety. We ended up feeling very safe, because the glass door to the hotel is always locked and they buzz you in only after you ring the bell and they see you through the security camera. There were also security cameras in the elevator of the building and in the hallway outside our room. The bakery (Roscioli) right next door to the Dependence is FABULOUS! Lots of locals, especially at lunchtime, getting pizzas and bread. The Campo area is right in the middle of it all. Overall, for someone looking for a clean, simple, safe hotel in a great location, I think you couldn't do any better than Smeraldo Dependence.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location is all I can say”
Reviews.Author: WKtraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and clean, but that's about it. We stayed there for 2 nights, and we were happy to leave. When we arrived it was early because of our flight, we were surprised to find out that there was no locked place to leave our luggage. Then ended up giving us one of the two rooms we reserved...but reluctantly. We have traveled in Europe before, and have experienced showers that are difficult to use....but this one had no hot water and a shower curtain constantly sticking to you throughout the experience. We had an air conditioner that worked, but my parents had one that constantly ticked throughout the night. We also met other travelers that air conditioner didn't work at all. I know Rick Steve's says this is a great deal....but I just don't get it.

Reviews.Title: “Barely OK - just a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: FoodyExpress
Reviews.Content: Was here with a group for several days. The rooms were small. Ours was on a central well and was dark with no real natural light. It was however quiet, as it looked on to the centre of the hotel. Other members of our group had rooms over the street. Still small and a bit noisy if you wanted a quiet night's rest. Our room was more of a corridor, rather than a square room. The bed was really the only place to sit. The TV was old and small. The advertised air conditioning never worked. This was the same for all our party. The desk said they were waiting for it to be fixed, but it looked more like it was just turned off centrally to save money. The breakfasts were worth a miss. The orange juice was actually an orange flavoured drink - how could they do that in Rome. There was a roof terrace - not big but nice to get out of the room - nothing fancy - plastic seats. The main plus point is the location - near Navona and De Fiori. Don't plan to stay in - get out and see Rome - from dawn to dusk.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location, only”
Reviews.Author: sanfranciscogirl
Reviews.Content: The location is the best part of this hotel experience. The hotel itself is dreary and the staff unfriendly. The rooms are small and not as clean as I had read in reviews when I was originally looking to book. The showers, which have mold, are too small for anybody who is not trim to fit into. The staff, for the most part, is unresponsive, and often rude. The location is its best attribute, within walking distance to the Colosseum, the Trevi Fountain, the Spanish Steps, Via del Corso, Piazza di Campo dei Fiori, and much more. While the price was certainly reasonable, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Smeraldo and Hotel In Parione”
Reviews.Author: Cal-and-Aly
Reviews.Content: Hotel In Parione is the sister hotel of Hotel Smeraldo. They are located right next to one another across a small street. We were surprised at the size and style. It was small, but had enough room for my husband and I. The shower was very tiny, but do-able. The staff was polite, but not overly friendly. Their shortness really did not ruin our stay. Our room was on the first floor and it was a bit noisy with the passersby below. Next time I would request a room on the 3rd or 4th floor, where it may be slightly quieter. The breakfast is not worth it, but there is a small bar across the street that serves breakfast and coffee in the morning. Roscholi Bakery is also right next door with yummy pasteries and bread. In fact, the hotel staff told me to tell the taxi driver it was next to the Roscholi bakery because everyone knows that bakery and he wasn't kidding! It was a perfect landmark. The location of the hotel is perfect because it really is within walking distance to most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms....”
Reviews.Author: wooble5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from March 9-13th, 2007 First I must say that the hotel was just what we expected. We had been recommended this hotel by some friends who stayed here years ago and loved it. It met our needs and was a wonderful location. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a good location that has clean rooms and a competent staff. We don’t regret our choice at all, and unless stumbling across a better deal – would stay here again. The hotel was always prompt returning emails. Anytime I emailed, they responded quite quickly. We used the hotels car transfer for 55€, and it was very good. Had I done my research I found there is a cheaper transfer through Rome Shuttle Limousine for 35€. But the hotel’s car service was just fine and on time. The driver spoke some, but little English, which was fun because I was able to practice my Italian. When I had called, they mentioned we could probably check in when we arrived around 9:00am however, we ended up having to wait about 2 hours. They offered to let us keep our luggage in the back sitting room, but it wasn’t secure so we opted to sit and wait. The front desk was friendly and fine. No one was rude. They were mostly helpful. The rooms were fine. Just that – rooms, no frills. Yes, the rooms were small, although large enough to be functional. Everything worked fine as well. No complaints. And the rooms were very clean. So for the location, the rooms were just what we had been looking for. The bathroom again, was small but functional. We did have problems with the water temperature. It wasn’t always hot, and would get cold during the shower and yes… the fans in the bathroom are very loud. You aren’t able to turn on the light separately, so you have no choice but to use them. And once you have turned off the light, the fan stays on for another 3-5 minutes. And I agree about the breakfasts. Not good. We were not smart enough to ask them to remove the breakfasts from our room price; we didn’t know that was an option. The breakfasts were less than mediocre and consisted of hard bread, weird ham, cheese, and orange juice that was more like tang. We skipped breakfast there and went across the street most days. We loved the little place across the street. We LOVED their fresh squeezed red orange juice, and most mornings we each ordered café latte, OJ and a pastry. For two, we usually paid about 8€. Our only other complaint was the noise. Not from the outside street… but from the other rooms. The walls were quite thin, and you could here quite a bit. I don’t believe the other guests were necessarily being loud; I just think the walls were thin. However, the noise from the street was minimal, and what we did hear was fun to hear – scooters, mainly. But none of the noise was too bad… it’s just an observation for those light sleepers out there. All that said, the location was the main perk. Very close to Campo di Fiori. Maybe a 3-5 minute walk. Also close to the Pantheon and Piazza Navona (maybe a 15 minute walk). We even walked to the Coliseum and yes, Vatican City. Although, we were quite tired after those walks. I wouldn’t necessarily call those sites walking distance, but only a little over a mile maybe. Cabs were pricy there, and a little scary (scarier than NYC cabs). So we kept cab rides to a minimum. But although it may sound like I am nit-picking, we liked the hotel a lot and would return. I was just making honest statements so that readers can read all the facts and make a well informed decision. For the price, the hotel was just right and the location was even better. As for Rome, here are my tips on Rome: We did not find it unsafe and had no problems. Favorite dinners were at Ditrambo (a great option for Sundays, since many places are closed. It was our favorite restaurant in Rome and close to the hotel) and Matricianella near the Spanish Steps. We found ordering one antipasta, two first courses and sharing a second course was the best way to keep the bill down. We also ate at Colline Emiliane, and in my opinion it was not charming and was over-rated and over-priced. Also, Rome is much much larger than other cities we visited. We probably walked 2-3 miles a day at least. We didn’t take buses or cabs much, and so maybe that is our own fault, but just a note to bring some comfortable walking shoes. Also, we did make the mistake of eating right on Campo di Fiori…awful. Our waitress was from Pittsburg if that says anything. Eat right off the square at Ditrambo or Costanza. I also wish I got to try Da Armando al Pantheon near the Pantheon, but we never did. Another thing I noticed in Rome…. Not as many people spoke English as I had expected. Everyone told me, “Oh, everyone in Rome speaks English.” Not so true. Most everyone at restaurants and hotels did… and the main tourist sites…but besides that… not so much. And not one of the cab drivers we dealt with spoke English. Luckily DH and I took a few courses last year and were in decent shape… but out of all the cities we visited, Rome was the most difficult to communicate in. Maybe we are rare… but that’s what we found.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: MerseysideTourist
Reviews.Content: Seven of us stayed here on a "girls" weekend away for 3 nights in 3 rooms. We had no complaints about noise or smells and all the rooms were on the first floor. We didn,t ask much from the reception staff, they were fine except for one grumpy man on the night before we left who huffed and tutted when there was a bit of confusion about the bill. The hotel is clean and comfortable in a very good location, we used the pick up service from and to the airport, it was 90 euros each way and well worth it. Weren,t too impressed with some of the places we ate in Campo de Fori and Piazza Navona, mabye we should have done more research. Don,t go to Babingtons tea rooms near the Spanish Steps, we paid 104 euros for 7 cups of tea and some not very good cake. Would stay at this hotel again without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Location makes it worth it.”
Reviews.Author: tmolta
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights here in March. The hotel is, for the most part, utilitarian, i.e., a place to get a good night's sleep. It is not fancy by any means but it is clean. Its location is what makes it great. You are smack dab in the middle of what I think is the most pleasant part of Rome: right near Campo de Fiori, and a short walk to Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, and Trastevere, three of my favorite parts of Rome. The fancy hotels on Via Veneto can't hold a candle to Smeraldo in terms of location, in my opinion. From the Smeraldo, you can pretty much walk everywhere (and we did!) A couple of things to beware of. First, the breakfast is horrible. Try to avoid buying it as part of your room rate. We had Rick Steves' current guidebook to Rome. After the first day, I inquired about excluding breakfast. They said it was included in our price. When I said the guidebook appeared to indicate otherwise, they asked if it was Rick Steves' book. I showed them my copy and they agreed to take 25 Euro off the price, per day, for no breakfast. 25 Euros was way more than needed for the three of us to have excellent continental breakfasts in the caffes nearby. Second, check out the fan in the bathroom when you check in. Others have complained about the noise and that was the first thing I noticed when I checked in. What a racket! The room next door had the same problem and they woke me up every morning just by using the bathroom. There is no "off" switch for the fan and despite what they tell you at the front desk, the noise never gets better.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fine”
Reviews.Author: AcornsSussex
Reviews.Content: Read the mixed reviews but booked direct anyway because we wanted somewhere central and affordable (with 5 people incl 3 children we couldn't afford the hotels on the Via Venetto!).
