We thought it was just fine and the location really couldn't be bettered. We had a double and an adjoining triple on the 4th floor quiet side and the room sizes were okay. It may be that some travellers from the USA aren't used to the size of european hotel rooms but I've travelled widely for business and privately and in my opinion at these rates the rooms were good. In any case, we were in them from 11pm to 8am apart from a late afternoon rest each day - you shouldn't be spending much of your time in Rome in your hotel room! The staff on the desk were, well, Italian! Which is to say they were, like the title to this short review, just fine. We really had no problems at all. To summarise, if you want a clean safe hotel in a great location at good rates, the Smeraldo should be a good choice for you. If you want 5 star service and large rooms with 5 star prices book a room at the Westin Excelsor on the Via Venetto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: AptosLeone
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Hotel Smeraldo and enjoyed every minute. It's down a narrow side street, and, yes you do wonder what you are getting into upon first arrival, but once there, its a great find. The hotel is clean and remodeled and the staff was very helpfull. You need to walk up a flight of stairs to get to the elevator, but this was no big deal for us. The location can not be better. We seemed to be able to walk everwhere -- and I did one day.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoMusicFan
Reviews.Content: A good price for Rome. I paid 100 Euros a night for a queen bed. They gave me a discount becuase I mentioned Rick Steves book. The location was good, near Campo de Fiori. The staff was a little rude, and was not very helpful as far as recommended sites/restaurants. It was a typical budget European hotel. The room was clean, but nothing great. It was definitely small, but that doesn't bother me. The bed was just slightly uncomfortable. The bathroom was very small, but adequate. Overall, I'd say it was a good budget hotel. If I were going to Rome, I would consider this hotel again, but I'd probably also look for other hotels with good locations in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a location”
Reviews.Author: ian444
Reviews.Content: You cannot get a better location in Rome than this hotel 5 minutes walk from the Campo De Flori Piazza Nova, Pantheon and the River Tiber. Yes the rooms are small but clean, some of the staff can be off putting but others were very helpful. But you should not be in this hotel except to sleep, you are slap bang in the middle of the eternal city. Excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: “Problem with reservation”
Reviews.Author: treetownie
Reviews.Content: Cute place, good location within Rome (although there are MANY hotels in this area). I had a problem with my reservation. My email communications with the hotel indicated I had reserved a room for 6 nights, but when I arrived they claimed to have no record of it ( a travelor's nightmare). They gave me a room for 2 nights, but the 2 gentlemen at the desk were quite disagreeable, arrogant and unhelpful. They said they would assist me in finding alternative accomodations, but clearly did not do so. I was able to find another place without any difficulty.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good price”
Reviews.Author: Dreamin of Travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the beginning of November and had a good experience. I had read reviews on here (after booking) and read about smelly rooms on the first floor. Of course, they gave me a room on that floor but changed it to the fourth floor when I asked (i never saw, or smelled, the first room). Our room was decent size and was clean and comfortable. The location was great and we could walk everywhere. The staff wasn't overly friendly or in your face, which i prefer, but they were helpful when I had questions. They made restaurant reservations for us and they helped us find football/soccer tickets. I would stay here again, especially because the price was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - But will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Oliver456
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this hotel in November. The room was comfortable, the bathroom wasn't large but it was more than adequate. The place was spotless. We would not stay here again. The managers were the most unfriendly people I have encountered in the hotel business. We did not bother them with any questions. It was made very clear in the beginning they were not interested in being of any assistance. They acknowledged our presence only when we made them, by speaking to them first. The housekeeping staff was very friendly and pleasant and they do an excellent job of keeping the place clean. On our next visit to Rome we will take our business elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: kildareman
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights.Yes it can be noisy ,but the rooms are spotlessly clean and adequately furnished.The staff were friendly,breakfast was ok and the location is absolutely superb.It would be difficult to get a better hotel at the prices they charge. It is perfectly situated for exploring rome and there are loads of restaurants and bars nearby. In contrast to some of the other comments,we found nothing negative at all . Go and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Smeraldo”
Reviews.Author: worldroamers
Reviews.Content: The Smeraldo is a charming little hotel in the heart of Rome. it is surrounded by great restaurants and trattorias, and within walking distance of many of the sights of rome, i.e. the Trevi Fountain, Campo di Fiori, and the Pantheon. Being a part of the downtown picture was important to us, and we spent hours wandering the narrow streets, stopping to enjoy gelato or panninis or just sitting on a bench watching the people. At night we frequently ate at neighborhood restaurants or the trattoria across the street which was excellent. Although the hotel is in the middle of downtown it is quiet when the windows are closed, and air conditioning is adequate. We, however, frequently left the windows open so we could enjoy the sounds of the night and the church bells in the morning. While the rooms and bathrooms are small, they are clean and comfortable. The beds were excellent, and the bathrooms in good working order. The staff was friendly and very helpful. They gave us good advice on directions and things to see as well as making sure that we were well taken care of. The breakfast was quite good and rivaled what we later found in much more expensive hotels. We hope to someday return to the Smeraldo as it was a wonderful introduction to our three week stay in italy.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for 5 nights”
Reviews.Author: rachel101
Reviews.Content: I can't say that I experienced any of the issues that previous guests appear to have encountered. I booked 5 nights as part of a round the world trip and was on a budget so was worried about whether it would be a mistake. When I arrived the staff were very grumpy, but the room was large and airy with french windows overlooking the street below. The location of the hotel was excellent being within walking distance of all major sites including the Vatican City, The Trevi Fountain and the Forum and only a short stroll from restaurants and shops. Breakfast was adequate and fair....as far as you can say that about Italian breakfasts. The room was air conditioned but could only be controlled by reception which was sometimes frustrating. A perfectly fine hotel for someone looking to pay less than £100 a night in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, there must be better than this....”
Reviews.Author: Jen&Brad
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Rome for 3 nights and whilst we absolutely loved Rome itself we were unimpressed with this hotel. We travelled for 6 weeks through 11 hotels and were able to pick highs and lows for all of them but to be honest this was the worst experience we had for the price that we paid. The staff were unpleasant, they made us feel as though we were imposing on them by asking questions (places to eat, local maps, etc. normal stuff we thought), we even got a few sighs out of them when we asked some of our questions. It seemed as though they had somewhere better to be. The room was exceptionally small, you could literally jump from the front door, land on the bed, step from the bed and be in the bathroom. There was no space for suitcases, no security safe, no minibar. Some of these things I'm not that phased if I do or don't get but normally there are other positives that make these things seem less significant, here there was minimal we could be positive about. The location was good but we had trouble three times with transport who wouldn't take us all the way to the door as it was more down an alley than on a main street, so we did have to walk through back streets with our luggage before getting to the hotel. I can say from a positive side was that the room was clean and it had air conditioning, but that is as positive as I get.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough but lacked in some areas”
Reviews.Author: sgtoca
Reviews.Content: Was there for 4 nights. The rooms are small which I have come to accept for Italy. The washroom was also small and the shower really narrow and somehow kept flooding. We had asked for a room change only to be told that we can have another room for 2 nights then have to move again, hmm, not very good service, it was low season and I am certain they were not sold out so I felt they were not accomodating. The restaurants recommended by the front desk were mostly tourist traps and often we stroll to an alley away from the tourist traps to find a family owned restaurant that is far better and less expensive. We had wanted to change hotels but as we were not familiar with the city and were tired at this point after going to 3 other Italian cities, we decided to stay put. The A/C did not work very well. But the room was clean. Breakfasts was ok, simple bread, cookies, cereal, yogurt. Most Italian hotels provide similar breakfast so don't expect eggs or bacon. You can find lots of places around that serve eggs if u must have them in the morning. The hotel was within walking distance to most tourist sites, museums etc. Even walking to Ancient Rome, Coliseum, St Pietro's Basilica is doable, about 30-40 minute walk and when in Rome, u gotta walk as everywhere u turn, its a site to see, a ruin, amazing! We also did the Bus and Boat tour for one day and that was really fun, $13 per person and u get a 30-40 minute bus ride around the city followed by a half hour boat ride, great deal! If u need a change from pasta or pizza and want something light, I highly recommend a restaurant called Insalata Ricca about 5 minutes from this hotel that is amazing, They serve big bowls of salads (among other usual Italian fare) that is hearty and healthy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our group”
Reviews.Author: bopandnana
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed at the Smeraldo in June, 2006. We were very pleased. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable. The air conditioning was invaluable in the June heat. The price was exceptionally reasonable for Rome. We enjoyed the little bar/coffee shop across the little cobbled street as well as the trattoria adjacent to it. We walked everywhere from the hotel. The location is perfect! We will definitely stay at the Smeraldo on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at the Smeraldo”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Smeraldo on my second trip to Rome. You can not ask for a better location. You are central to all the tourist sites. The Vatican and the Colesseum are about equal distance each way from the hotel and a five minute walk to the Pantheon. Also the hotel is two short blocks from a major city bus stop, and the city bus will become your friend. I know other reveiwers are commenting on the small room sizes. Americans need to face the reality that European hotel rooms are much smaller than the American hotels. So do not knock the Smeraldo for having small rooms. I have been to four European countries and they all have small rooms. The only thing we did not like about our room was the shower was small. The breakfast in the morning was plenty. The staff was able to accomodate all of our requests in English!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice clean rooms. Walk to everthing. Highly recommended. Very helpful staff. All spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: BerkshireGal
Reviews.Content: Just back from six nights in Rome and we totally loved the Smeraldo! We booked our stay through Virgin Vacations and upgraded to the Smeraldo after reading favorable comments on this website. (Thank you tripadvisor fans!) This hotel is in such a great spot -- as several earlier reviewers mentioned, you can walk to all the major sites. We are both 60+ and we walked everywhere -- never used a bus or the subway. The location in the twisty, old cobbled streets just off the Campo dei Fiori was wonderful. After a busy day sightseeing, the Campo is the perfect spot to sit with a glass of wine and people watch. Lots of great restaurants on the Campo and nearby. The hotel itself was really perfect -- very clean, recently rennovated, with a polite and helpful staff. Our room on the third floor was roomy with a king-size bed (wonderful mattress!) and lots of storage space (which is handy when you are staying as long as we did and don't want to live out of your suitcase). We were lucky to have a room that opened to the back of the hotel -- we could see one of the hotel's terraces and the dome of a nearby church from our window. We slept with the window wide open, shutters thrown out and it was as quiet as if we were in a remote Tuscan village -- hard to believe in a city as noisy as Rome! The bathroom was very modern -- small shower stall but perfectly adequate unless you are an oversize person and the water was always hot. The breakfast was great -- Continental style but who needs a heavy, hot breakfast if you are eating a big lunch (Roman style) and dinner. The breakfast room which was always busy, was bright and cheery and everyone seemed happy with the selections. We highly reccommend the Smeraldo! And, thanks tripadvisor for making our Rome adventure memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean hotel - fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: weeangel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Smeraldo over Easter weekend and thought, for the price, it was absolutely perfect. The hotel is immaculately clean, very queit, the rooms are typical 'Italian' size but we weren't there to be in the hotel room! It is literally two minutes stroll from Campo di' Fiori and another couple to Piazza Navona and incredibly safe, walking back at night was no problem at all. We thought all of the staff were very nice and the concierge helped us book a taxi through a company we wanted (cheaper than the hotel offering) with no hesitation, none of the gruffness other visitors report. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Madtowntravelgirl
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Smeraldo in February, 2006, with my three children (ages 13, 10, 6). The best thing about the hotel is its location near the Campo de Fiori and within walking distance of just about all the major sites. The rooms were clean and relatively quiet, although noise does tend to carry from the corridors. The problem is that they are miniscule. Even though we rented two rooms, I could hardly stand to stay in them for more than 10 minutes as there wasn't even enough room to park the luggage, let alone accommodate three sprawling kids. The double bed in my room cleared three of the four walls by only a foot. The shower stalls were equally petite. The breakfast, however, was fairly generous by Italian standards, with a selection of rolls, croissants, meats, cheeses, cereal, fruit and yogurt. There is also a very good bakery around the corner from the hotel that serves excellent slices of pizza and various breads and pastries for a lot less. The room price was a bit high in my opinion, around 170 euro for a triple. I recommend this hotel for couples or individuals traveling without children who want a great location and plan to spend only a minimal amount of time in the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Smeraldo for 4 nights in early April. While the double room we had was a little on the small side and not well lit, the bathroom was quite the opposite -- spacious by Italian hotel standards. The rooms were kept very clean. The location was really the strong point. We could and did walk to everything. It is only a couple of blocks from the Pantheon and the Campo de Fiore. I had been concerned about a possible noise issue wiith being on the 1st floor, but the windows and shutters do an excellent job of mitigating the noise, and the street is not a major thoroughfare anyway. Breakfast is about average for Italy, not the best we saw nor the worst. The problem we had was that there was an unpleasant odor with our room on the 1st floor. I had asked for a change but they could not/would not move us. My daughter took to calling it the Hotel Smelldorado. Our experience with the staff was that they were very responsive in terms of helping with maintenance needs, taxis, etc. (except for the ability to re-locate us) but they were not particularly outgoing otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great little find”
Reviews.Author: KelvinYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Smeraldo and found the hotel perfect for our requirements-great location surrounded by bars, cafes and boutiques- friendly staff who advised us on bus numbers and arranged taxis for us- adequate breakfast-clean, modern tasteful rooms (with hair dryers)and good value for money. Only down side was the air conditioning was not very effective and my parents room was on the noisier side of the street (310). The other 2 rooms were very quiet (306 and 107). A great find in a beautiful part of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “What a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: jamtam
Reviews.Content: We loved the Smeraldo Hotel. The location was fabulous and we found the staff to be very helpful with any requests we had. Our room overlooked a small street with a bakery, was fun to watch them making bread in the mornings. I would definitely return to this hotel for our next visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great All Around Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SLC24
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was perfect. You could walk to almost everything! The rooms were very nice and clean and I found the concierge to be very helpful. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from Rome and overall had a great stay. The hotel is ideally located as it is within walking distance of all the sights. It is also good for restaurants and nightlife. Two things to be slightly wary of are: Room 101 - we were put in there on our first night and from the moment we walked in we could smell the drains which wasn't too pleasant and most likely the explanation for them constantly opening our window (despite it being February!). We were moved on our second day so this wasn't much of a problem however it was a nuisance having to move our bags again. The only other thing to be aware of is the taxi drivers that hang round Termini (esp when the ryanair bus gets in). From Termini to the hotel we were charged 30Euros when we returned to meet the ryanair bus we were only charged 10Euros, this was booked by the hotel!.

Reviews.Title: “Note about their booking policy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Though I found B&B that is little more expensive (40 euros) the amenitites are way better (the book restaurants, museums, breakfast included, etc.). I just wanted to point out that when you book with Hotel Smeraldo not matter how far in advance (5 months for me) and then cancel your reservation the will not refund the first night so you're out $150 dollars. Most places have a 15 days policy but this place is different. I just wanted to point out this lack of flexibility for those who may not know.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in an excellent, central location within walking distance (usually 10mins) of all the major attractions. The hotel and rooms were in an excellent, clean condition. Although rooms weren't massive, they certainly accomodated 2 adults comfortably for 5 nights stay. All hotel staff spoke excellent english and were friendly and helpful at all times. Our room (210), although facing the road, was quiet and we were not disturbed from noise levels. This hotel is an excellent choice for those who want modern, comfortable and clean accomodation within walking distance of all the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: HHOG
Reviews.Content: Good points: - Central, good location - walking distance to all the main sights. - Clean. Bad points: - Noisy (e.g. vacuuming in the corridor started at 8.30am in the morning - not a place to get a lie-in. There was also quite a lot of noise from the other rooms. Very noisy fan in the bathroom). - Small rooms - hardly room to swing a cat. - No hot water on our second morning. - No atmosphere - not a place to relax in. If you just want somewhere clean to sleep in a good location then this hotel is fine. If your expectations aren't high then you will find it ok but I found it hard to get particularly excited about the place!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: vermontsue
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Rome and a five night stay at Hotel Smeraldo. The room was immaculate, we had fresh towels and sheets every day, and the staff could not have been nicer. They booked opera tickets for us and were quite friendly. We stayed in room 405 and it was bigger than some of the others, also very quiet. We paid 100 euros/night for the room, even though it was advertised for 125 euros. We asked for a discount since we were not eating breakfast. I highly recommend Smeraldo - location was perfect. We were 5 minutes walk from Campo de Fiori, and Piazza Navona and an easy walk to almost everything else (Spanish Steps, Trevi 15 minute walk tops).

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, great neighborhood, great price!”
Reviews.Author: italchk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Smeraldo in Rome for 5 nights in October. We paid 125E per night, a rate guaranteed if we showed them our Rick Steves Italy 2005 book which recommends it. We read all of the reviews on tripadvisor and found the hotel to exceed our expectations. Hotel Smeraldo is in a lovely neighborhood, just a 3 or 4 minute walk to the Campo de Fiori. The rooms are tastefully decorated and most of the furnishings as well as the bathroom appeared to be almost new. The bed was quite firm and we thought we would find it uncomfortable to sleep on but this was not the case. We slept fine and the firmness of the mattress did not bother us at all which was a surprise. The room was extremely clean and maid service was excellent. As suggested in the Rick Steves book, we asked for a "quiet" room (away from the street) and although we were told they would do their best but could not guarantee this, they accomodated us and we had very quiet room away from the street. The maid service starts by 8 a.m so if you like to sleep late you might be annoyed by the noise generated in the halls during their cleanups.They had a "hairdryer' which is a nozzle that comes out of the wall and it blows hot air. If you need to style your hair, bring your own with a converter/adapter. Warm, hot water was plentiful if you took your shower early. Our daughter took a shower a bit later once and only got lukewarm water. Upon our return to Rome and Hotel Smeraldo (we went to Siena for several days then came back to SMeraldo for one night), we were in a room that faced the street and it was rather noisy (street traffic,etc) but we took care of this by leaving the bathroom fan on all night. This worked like a charm in blocking out the noise. THey also gladly stored most of our luggage in the luggage room for us when we traveled to Siena (we came back to Smeraldo as I previously stated) so we would not have to drag it back and forth with us. There was no charge for this. Many reviews have stated that the staff is unfriendly or rude. They were a bit aloof at times, but since I knew that this might be a problem before I came there, I decided to go out of my way and be friendly to them each time I saw them. I would greet them in Italian and smile at them every time I passed the reception desk. Try it everywhere in Italy and you will be pleasantly surprised. They speak excellent English but seemed to appreciate my effort to greet them intheir language. They always helped me with anything I needed. They are not very social,but people should not miscontrue this to mean they are rude and unfriendly.Shy and somewhat aloof at times,perhaps but certainly not rude. Read about the Italians and their customs etc before you go and don't expect everything to be like it is in the US. Breakfast is available for about 8E per person but we did not buy it and it did not look like anyone else did either. There was only one person there making coffee our first morning and no one was even there on the subsequent mornings. Walk right our the door and cross the street and take a few steps to your left and there is an excellent cafe. Very reasonable coffee and cornettos(like a croissant). Remember though, you are in Italy and will pay extra if you sit. Eat at the bar and it is very cheap. You are a 5 minute walk from the bus stop and 10-20 minutes from most of the big attractions(Pantheon,Piazza Navonna, Colosseum,etc). The Vatican would probably be the longest walk --about 20 -25 minutes maximum. If you don't want to walk it, just take the bus 64 allthough it is usually very crowded and you will probably stand. There are many restaurants in the Campo de Fiori neighborhood in all price ranges. You can also stop at one of the nighborhood shops and pick up a slice of pizza for 1 or 1.50E. If you choose this hotel, you will be pleasantly surprised. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just spent a very pleasant weekend at the Hotel Smeraldo. Rooms are fairly small but look newly decorated and are very clean. Great location within walking distance of all the central sites and also a good choice of nightlife areas; I would recommend heading 5 minutes walk across the river to Trastavere. At night closing the double glazed windows keeps the bedrooms nice and quiet. Breakfast is good; we had ours included in the room price, possibly as an out of season deal. Very good value and recommended. Good time of year to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend Hotel Smeraldo”
Reviews.Author: Kirbyp
Reviews.Content: We just returned form staying at the Hotel Smeraldo in Rome. The hotel is very centrally located; within minutes of the Campo de' Fiori; within walking distance of the Pantheon, Colosseum and the Vactican. The rooms are quite small but adequate. The room was clean. There was quite a bit of noise in the evenings from street traffic but I think that might be a problem most anywhere in Rome!! There are many small cafes, wine bars and restaurants close by. We opted for a little cheaper rate that did not include the continental breakfast. With all the nearby places to eat I would recommend others doing the same.

Reviews.Title: “Compact but good value and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recommended by a Roman and I enjoyed my stay there. Campo de Fiori, Piazzo Navona and many other sites are within easy walking distance. Lots of nice, not too expensive restaurants nearby. The rooms were compact, as you'd expect in a Roman side street but the furniture and fittings were good quality and in good condition though the shower was a bit of a tight fit! The hotel staff were most helpful and friendly and the breakfast better than average. They also spoke good English. I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great location!”
Reviews.Author: laritrav
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Smeraldo for 5 nights and really enjoyed it!! A couple of important points: 1. don't judge a book by its cover - the outside of the hotel does not look nice (there's graffiti on the walls) and it makes it look like maybe this is not a nice place to stay. When you walk in, it's a whole different picture. They recently renovated and it is a nice, clean and comfortable hotel. 2. The bathroom is small. I am not trying to offend so please do not take this the wrong way. Realistically, if you have trouble fitting in airplane seats, you will most likely have difficulty with the size of the shower. And I find this an important point to bring up because it has such great impact on your experience at this hotel. Our room and bathroom were very small but were always clean and had been redone not too long ago. The bathroom was all marble and looked very nice. When we got there, the AC was on and it was very cold in there. We didn't find a controller in the room but were able to reach the AC by standing on a chair and turned it off right on the unit itself. Our room faced a street with a restaurant and at night it did get pretty noisy - but once you close the window, you can't hear it anything anymore and can have a peaceful night's rest. At the same time, in the evening, you get the benefit of listening to the various artists playing music for the restaurant patrons. It was very nice! The personnel at the reception desk was extremely helpful and friendly!! (and spoke English). The breakfast was great with many choices. The location is perfect!! 10 min walk to Piazza Navona; 5 min walk to Campo de Fiori Piazza; 15 min walk to Vatican; 10 min walk to Pantheon; 15 min walk to Forum/Colosseum; 5 min walk to main bus stop; 5 min walk to a bank; and many great restaurants close by. In my mind, the location couldn't have been better! So overall, great hotel with an awesome location (and good price for the location) but some considerations to space need to be kept in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Hampy
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Hotel Smeraldo in June 2005. The location is amazing - walking distance to all of the major sites - - right around the corner from Campo Di Fiori & a couple of blocks from Piazza Navona. The Pantheon is also about a 5 minute walk. The rooms comfortable and quite nice. The front desk staff wasn't overly helpful, but the location makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: mharden
Reviews.Content: Two blocks from the Campo di Fiori, two more to Piazza Navona...within walking distance of almost every major site in Rome, and only one block from Largo Argentina, a major point for mass transit. Yes, the showers are tiny, and the shower doors difficult to close. The rooms are adequate in size, in marble and wood, with up-to-date fixtures. The air conditioning is effective, although there is no thermostat in the room (on or off via front desk is the only option), so it can get quite cold during the night. During an afternoon siesta, the sounds from the narrow medieval alleyways below offer a pleasing ambience...at night, closing the soundproofing doors allows you to sleep through the loudest motorcycle or truck bringing in produce for the daily Campo di Fiori market. The staff is efficient, courteous and speaks excellent English. The continental breakfast is good, although you can also drop in the bakery across the alleyway, and obtain fresh fruit from the market each morning but Sunday. There is a small but picturesque rooftop terrace with a great view of the neighborhood. I dropped a coin in the Trevi Fountain, so when we return, we'll stay at Hotel Smeraldo again...

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel”
Reviews.Author: egremont
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at this hotel at end of June beginning of July after reading previous reviews of hotel.The location was great,our room was very good,very clean,air con and very quiet.Roof terrace was unavailable unfortunately.Reception staff were fine,all spoke excellent English.Breakfast was typical Continental,no complaints and the coffee very good.Would stay here again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “poor”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: AC didnt work. Please dont expect American comforts in Europe unless you want to pay though the nose. I learned my lesson. Front desk was RUDE. Im tired of people saying that its 'European' No its called customer service. We asked where there was internet service and the man said "I dont know". Another person staying there asked where he could rent a car and the desk person said they didn't know. Very unfriendly and rude. Room was small and shower was tiny. I couldnt even fit in the darn thing. We actually left early and went to another hotel for the remainder of our stay. Paid a little more but had a real queen bed, AC that worked and hot food for breakfast. Dont want to advertise but it was much nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was a little worried when we arrived at the hotel up the small alleyway in the middle of the night. But it turned out to be a in a great location only a few minutes walk form all the key places - the main piazza's, Vatican, Pantheon, Roman Forum etc etc. The hotel is simply furnished but it is spotlessly clean and all the staff are really really helpful. I would definately recommend this hotel, I will be staying here again on my next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “location, simple, clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed on the second floor which is the third in italy, 0 being the first floor. we overlooked a bakery that was fantastic. eat there. the locals do. the room was small and clean. shower tiny. the staff was great. no problems with the front desk. they were very efficent and did evrything as promised. taxi waiting for us on arrival. room ready when they said it would be. third bed made up for us on the last night as another was joining us. the street action is wonderful to watch, better than any tv program. the room was quiet and the air conditioner was super cold! i will stay there again and tell all to do so. the location cannot be beat. i felt like i lived there!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Rbdfoxes
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Smeraldo Hotel from June 7th - June 12th. We are both students in our 20s and decided to splurge on a trip to Rome before I go home to the states. Our room at 140 euros a night was not the cheapest rate to be found in Rome, I'm sure, but we decided to take it because of the convenient location! It was really wonderful to be able to walk everywhere, and take a nap in the afternoon, and then walk two blocks to the Campo de Fiori for a nice long Italian dinner. We stayed in room 405 (the top floor), and our room was very large. We did peek into the rooms across the hall, and although they had little terraces, they were much much smaller than our room and they were over the street, whereas our room looked out over the other buildings (and into other apartments !). The staff wasn't overly friendly, but my boyfriend (being European) managed to convince me that they weren't being rude, they just didn't have the same American theory of customer service that I'm used to... He helped me to see that the staff was really quite accomodating, and friendly and helpful in their own way. They booked taxis for us to the airport, and happily served us from the bar, even when it wasn't officially open. There was someone at the desk 24/7 (where you are expected to leave your key when you go out). In all the hotel was very clean, the breakfast was the typical continental buffet, but the location is GREAT! I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory hotel with great Location.”
Reviews.Author: polly424
Reviews.Content: Comfortable stay at this hotel. It was hot while we were there and air conditioning was working well. Past hotels were meager. It was very clean and comfortable. The "behind the scenes" workstaff were very friendly (which made up for the lukewarm front desk, as stated by another review). Breakfast was nothing to write home about. I've had lots better. It was stated that it was a noisey hotel. I don't agree. It could depend on your room I suppose. Ours was 213 and very quiet. We were there in June which i would guess is busier than April which is when the others were there. I wished that they had internet access. (I would have been willing to pay) I have had that in past hotels and would ask that question when booking next hotel. However I would stay there again because of it's great location. We walked everywhere. There was great fresh mozzarella around the corner at a local gormet shop, and a spa where we had a massage to take care of those sightseeing feet.(ask for Melissa(?) from New Jersey, or Gloria whose an Italian with 10 Years under her belt. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CalifTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Smeraldo Hotel for three nights and it was nice, the room was nice and clean. The front desk was lukewarm but who really cares when you are not in Rome to see the front desk people. Thanks tripadvisor for helping us chose a nice and clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from Rome”
Reviews.Author: Piaga
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, room is small, as is everything in Italy. The rate was reasonable and the staff was lukewarm. Good location, however the noise at night/early morning is unbelievable - I'm surprised I slept at all. I can't recommend it to people who want a good night's sleep - the noise outside our hotel never stopped, let alone in the hallways.

Reviews.Title: “great locationLocated in a great position for all”
Reviews.Author: Castello
Reviews.Content: located in a great position2 minutes from the Campo Fiori. Get the train from tthe airport to Trastevere then the number 8 tram to the end of the line and you are practically outside the door. The hotel was clean , breakfast was nothing to shout home about but OK. The only down side was that the walls were so thin that when the first person was up everyone was up as you could hear every sound.All in all a good hotel I would be happy to reccomend

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Smeraldo”
Reviews.Author: Tines0110
Reviews.Content: We would recommend this hotel to anyone. We stayed for six nights/seven days and really enjoyed our time at the Smeraldo. The location was EXCELLENT. Every major site was within walking distance for the average walker--the hotel is an equal distance from the Vatican, the Spanish Steps, and the Coliseum. Good restaurants, ATMs, nice shops, tabacchi (for phone cards, stamps, and postcards) were all within two blocks of the hotel. The rooms were impeccably cleaned everyday with all towels changed everyday and all the little soaps and shampoos refilled. The breakfast each morning was more than adequate and an excellent way to get ready for a long day at the sites--no hot food but a good array of baked good, cereal, yogurt, etc. Room 100 was slightly small for two people but all European hotel rooms are I suppose, and the bathroom was quite large. The only complaint that we had was that the room was quite damp and a bit cool in the evenings even with the heat on, but other rooms did not seem to have this problem. The staff isn't particularly friendly, but always willing to try and help. For great food at a good price try S. Anna's Ristorante (just a few steps away to the right!) and for cheap food try Insalata Ricca right off Corso Emmanuel a couple blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for 1st trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bearcat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Smeraldo for five nights in March 2005. The hotel met of exceeded or expectations in every category. The room was clean and a decent size for two with ample closet space, shower was small but that is expected in Europe right?. Hotel arranged airport pickup and return (55E/48E) and followed up to make sure there were no problems. Didn’t have to walk more than about 200 yards to find a great restaurant each night. Able to walk to all the major sights, ~30 minutes to either the Colosseum or Vatican. Can’t comment on the breakfast as we were out the door each morning but, there is a decent coffee shop across the alley and several automated teller machines in the area. Everyone on the staff we encountered was English speaking and we did not find anyone unwilling to help no matter what the question or request. Our room faced the interior of the building and noise was not a problem at all. Not fancy but it was clean, helpful, inexpensive, and in a great location. We will definitely stay at the Smeraldo again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Rude!”
Reviews.Author: cargio17
Reviews.Content: We were late arriving to our hotel by several hours. When we arrived the man at the front desk actually yelled at me that I was late and it was past check in. He had booked our room and charged us. He said that the hotel was competely booked up now, but he would help us find another hotel in Rome. I was furious I left and found a delightful place a couple of blocks away. I dont understand why he was yelling at me when he got my money, and the money of who ever was staying in our room. Very poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect location for your first visit to roma!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights in Feb 2004 and enjoyed it tremendously! It's location is perfect!! I was a few blocks away from the campo de fiorio - with it's sunday morning market - and well within walking distance to all the main sights. And How wondeful to hear the street musician playing his accordian just outside my window! A wonderful mom-n-pop leather shop was cattie-corner to the entrance and my morning capucino shop was on the way to the piazza. all in all, for my first european vacation, this hotel was awesome. I have recommended the hotel smerlado t to many of my friends who are traveling to rome!

Reviews.Title: “A gem!”
Reviews.Author: sman415
Reviews.Content: We loved our (4 days plus one day) stay at this charming hotel. Though the room was very small, the bed was firm and spacious for two. The room was also warm and quiet, so we slept well. The staff was very helpful, and even stored our winter clothing for 10 days while we travelled to Africa. We found it convenient for us to travel to and from the airport by train (FM 1, 5 Euros; and Tram 8, 1 Euro per person) and it took about 50 minutes each way and was fun (we didn't have too much luggage). The hotel is well-located in a charming neighborhood, two blocks from Campo dei Fiori and its daily market til 2pm, and another three blocks to Piazza Navonna. (Everything seems like just a short walk in Rome, but wear shoes with good support, because of the uneven cobblestones.) It is also two blocks from an internet cafe (on Via Arenula), one short block from an ATM, and a short walk across the Ponte Sisto from Trastavere neighborhood. I was generally pleased with the unexceptional breakfast, finding the granola and yogurt a nutritious way to start the day, augmented by ham and cheese slices when I was hungrier. But do leave room for the antipasto misto della casa at L'Orso 80 and the gelato at Gelateria della Palma.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Smeraldo for 4 nights prior to Christmas. At a rate of 100 euros per night for the room incl breakfast it's fantastic value for money. The room we stayed in (111) had clearly been recently refurbished and was very nice, albeit on the small side. The location is perfect with all the must see tourist sights within easy walking distance. The Vatican museums are probably the furthest away of all, but is no more than a 20 minute stroll away. Would thoroughly recommend staying at this hotel. Enjoy Rome it is a truly spectacular city!

Reviews.Title: “perfect for a stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Suzetim
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after reading all the reveiws. It is in a great locations, we could walk all over Rome from here, nowhere was too far. Great for walking out at night to and getting to buzzzing squares. Would highly recommend. The staff were helpful, but not too smiley. Breakfast was nothing special very basic really, but loads of places to eat locally. The rooms were very clean and ours was a good size, we were in 306. They will arrange taxi to pick up from airport, cost was about 45 to 50 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: WhereNowBasingstoke
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Smeraldo in late October, following a recommendation in the London "Daily Telegraph". The hotel arranged a car to pick us up at Fiumicino (55 euros) - which was probably just as well as, although we quickly got used to the geography, finding the hotel the first time would have been interesting. We were very pleased that our triple room had a separate area for the single bed, giving some privacy. Room was recently refurbished and comfortable: and, yes, the shower is small - but that's fairly normal in Europe (and the water was plentiful and hot - which is less normal!!). Although we had the windows open, external noise was not intrusive and, although nosie reverberated in the public areas, there were only 2 other rooms on our landing, so the impact was minimal. Breakfast was excellent - but beware day-old bread on Sundays - and the breakfast room can be mayhem if a tour party is in! We found the reception staff generally very helpful. The location is superb - we were able to walk everywhere without using public transport. The bakers round the corner is brilliant (try their pizza slices) and there's an abundance of restaurants nearby (although better value is probably found slightly away from Campo d' Fiori and Piazza Navona - we liked the Monserrato in the street of the same name). We'd have no hesitation in returning to the Smeraldo.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Tenoka2000
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 10 days in Italy, (wife, me and my mother) we rented a double and a single room and stayed our first three days in Italy at the Smeraldo Oct 31, Nov 1&2. The Hotel was super and the price is right. Having now stayed in several other italian hotels of comparable price, this one was a good value. We found the front desk help to be extremely helpful, for example my mom anticipated that she would be wiped out from the flight over and had asked me to reserve a room for an additional night so she could check in immediately at 9am when we arrived. They informed me that they were booked solid but when we arrived they had her room ready and she was able to check in and go to sleep. (This saved her about 105euros). Yes the Hotel is loud, I don't think italians sleep. We had a room off the main road and had the windows cracked open to keep things cool. The baker across the street begins his day at 4am and scooters pick up fresh breads to deliver to hotels at 5am and you can set your watch by it. Also the hotel is nestled between two churches with great bell towers. In every city we stayed in the church bells go off vigourously at 7am so everybody gets up! Needless to say with two sets of bells it was pretty well heard but hey, it gets you up and youre here to see the City not sleep anyway right? Location, location, location!! This place is literally a 20 minute walk from the Vatican, Roman Forum, Colleseum, everything you want to see when you're there. This also saves you bucks as you can walk or drop a whopping 6 euros to taxi wherever you want to go. Check out Rick Steve's guide book and do the evening walking tour to the Spanish Steps via the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain, again you're in the Campi di Fiori at the hotel so it's a great 90 minute stroll and is beautiful! I will stay here again when I return with my daughters (but with no air conditioning I'll go in Nov or April).

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Smeraldo for 4 nights beginning October 25, 2004. The hotel's strongest point is its location, close to the Campo de' Fiori, Piazza Navona, etc. The hotel staff was competent if not overly friendly. The room (a double) was OK, although the bed and pillow were like cement and the shower was the size of a phone booth (literally!). The biggest drawback was the NOISE! Not the outside noise as the windows did a good job on reducing that but the inside noise. You could hear conversations easily through the walls as well as bathroom sounds you'd rather not hear. The noise from outside the room in the hallway was unbelievable. In addition, there were tour groups booked during our stay and the breakfast room was pretty much unavailable. So, while the location is great we wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: John_Z_MN
Reviews.Content: The Smeraldo is a sparkling clean back alley place near the Campo de' Fiori. The rooms and bathrooms are small but well kept and the main sites of Rome are walkable if you're in any kind of shape. The staff was a little abrupt but the rooftop patio (bring your own wine in the evening) and the neighborhood of shops, bakeries and restaurants more than made up for any slights. This would have been a 3 but for location and value (E120) we give it a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Just Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Smeraldo is perfect. It is in a central location right down from a major bus stop where you can catch a bus to just about anywhere (Rome's busses are surprisingly easy to use) and they sell bus tickets at the desk so you don't have to go to a Tabacchi. Despite its central location, it is in a quiet little corner of the area with only a small amount of noise from passing pedestrians (and no car noise). The hotel is beautiful, especially the circular staircase, the rooms are small but clean with no smoke smell (a huge issue with other hotels in Italy), and the breakfast is fairly comprehensive with muesli and yogurt available in addition to pastries. The desk staff was always nice. For the price, this is an incredible value and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch?”
Reviews.Author: good2be
Reviews.Content: We made reservations over 4 months ago for Hotel Smeraldo for 3 rooms. Upon arrival, we were told that only 2 of the 3 rooms would be available and that they had made reservations at a hotel nearby for the other room. Fortunately the other hotel was just around the corner however we were very disappointed to be switched to a lower end hotel (2 stars maximum) and expected to pay the same price. Only when we refused, were we offered a lower price. The staff at Smeraldo were not friendly or helpful. I recommend you keep looking unless location is the only thing you care about when staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from 5 nights at the Smeraldo Hotel. It was a perfect hotel! I would gladly stay there again. Price was reasonable and the location is perfect. Walking to the Vatican, Coliseum, Spanish Steps all took less than 20minutes. You can't drive or park in this town, so having someplace to stay that's central is a must. Keep in mind this is Europe, so the rooms are a bit small compared to the States and the showers are even smaller. I've been all around Europe on business and this is a typical room setup...actually a bit larger than most. I highly recommend this hotel. Also, get a good map of Roma before you leave....and a compass.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel. It is centrally located, walking distance from Piaza Navono. The staff is extremely friendly, polite and helpful. Breakfast was included in the price and was delicious I highly recommend it to everyone who is on a tight budget, but still expects a nice service.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay. Clean, nice rooms; friendly (and VERY helpful) staff; and great location! We went to Rome for part of our honeymoon- and this hotel was an excellant choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Will_Travelll
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at this hotel, but it was my second choice and as I wandered about town I came across it and took a look. The hotel is down an uninteresting side street, and close to a small piazza with a cafe at one corner. The hotel looks wonderful for its type, a small foyer & nice reception. The receptionist was kind and let us look around the hotel and even showed us one of the rooms. Unless we were especially shown the best room it was a goodly size, clean and had a lovely en-suit room. There are two small roof gardens, one had a good view of the roof tops and Domes which speckle the Roman skyline. It's position in Campo Di Fiori is not spectacular but is close to all the main sights. Night life might be a problem for those wanting such. Nearby there is De Campo Dei Fiori and not so far away is Piazza del Rotunda and Piazza Navona. During the day you can easily walk to all the major places of interest. The hotel is great and even greater is the price. Don't expect a 5*, it is at the top of its range, but expect good value, especially if you are not seeking a bustling night life. I shouldn't write about this hotel. I don't want it to get too full. This place is terrible, trust me I'm a traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: OxfordGirlOxfordUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights 8th - 11th Sept. in room 100. Room was small but very clean, bathroom larger but water tepid after 09:00 (!) Breakfast perfectly acceptable with rolls, pastries, cake, jams, honey, nutella, cereal etc. Staff very pleasant and helpful. Fantastic location.
